  37. Pros:<br />1. My teeth are definitely,visibly whiter! 😆😃<br />2. The more you use them, the more layers of stains they remove.<br />3. They are comfortable, don't move and all the chemicals stay in the casings and don't leak out into your mouth.👍<br /><br />Cons:<br />1. After only two uses, the strips left white spots on my teeth. They are now fading after about 2 1/2 weeks of use. *But this scared me at first. Also, this was little embarrassing as a person who smiles alot during my job working in Customer Service.<br />(The Oficial Website warns that some people may experience whites spots, but that they are not serious and will diminish with time.)<br />SIDEBAR - The reason I listed this is because after further research, I learned that whites spots can be results of decalification. (Some people's spots have never went away.)<br />Also, whitening strips can deteriorate your<br />enamel. (Enamel cannot be replaced)<br /><br />2. I experienced 3 Intense Nerve Shocks/Pains after three separate treatments. They really hurt, but only lasted for about 15 seconds. {It feels like someone is drilling a hole through your tooth}. 😭<br />After experiencing these sudden Nerve Shocks/Pains, I did more research and found that some customers have reported having sensitive teeth after using whitening strips. *Food for thought. 💡<br /><br />In Summary/In Conclusion<br /><br />My teeth are certainly whiter but I won't be using whitening strips again. Most likely I will pay for the $300 treatment at the dentist so I know for certain it will be safe and I will be fully aware and informed of all the parameters.<br />I only recommend this if you need really need it and have something coming up in a week. While my teeth are visibly whiter, the negatives effects outweighed the benefits.<br />I DON'T RECOMMEND LONG-TERM USE. (More than 20-30 DAYS of consistent use).<br /><br />This quote pretty much sums up my experience:<br />&#34;You don't know 'til ya know...&#34; ▔\▁(ヅ )▁/▔<br /><br />By the same token, you have now been warned and informed my fellow people. The choice is yours. Stay positive and never stop chasing your dreams!   50. I have used nearly 7 strips now and see a noticeable change in my teeth colour.<br />Although not completely bright but yellowness has started disappearing.<br />But I found after second use of strip the gums started hurting.<br />So here is how to avoid the pain:<br />1. Wash your teeth with water before applying the strips.<br />2. Apply the strips just before bed-time so that you wont be eating anything for next 6-10 hours.<br />3. Take the strips off after 30 minutes.<br />4. Now most important: brush your teeth thoroughly to clean away all the gel from your teeth and gums.<br />5. You will feel that your gum wont hurt as much next morning and teeth will start getting brighter.<br />6. If teeth still hurt, take a break for a day or two and dont use strips.<br />Hope this helps.

  67. I love this product. I have used it many times over the years since it first came on the market and have NEVER had an issue with them. They work exactly as you would expect. Actually, I think they work better than expected. I have always taken very good care of my teeth - they are naturally straight and white to begin with because I don't drink coffee or soda (anything that would cause stain) but still feel like my teeth get to looking &#34;dingy&#34; as I age. So every couple of years I will get me some of these and within no time, people start commenting how white and beautiful my teeth are. I must admit (and don't necessarily recommend) that I use them for longer than the package says. Most mornings when I put the strips on my teeth, I keep them there anywhere from 60 to 90 minutes and then brush my teeth as usual. If you are prone to sensitivity, I would not do this, but I have never had any issues. My teeth look amazingly white after using this product and definitely recommend it to anyone wanting a whiter/brighter smile.

Bad diet throughout my childhood and lack of care when it comes to brushing and flossing carefully have left my teeth an off-white that is not off-putting, but certainly lowers my self-esteem.<br /><br />After just one week of using these (more like 9 days with 2 random days skipped by accident) I am already noticing results. My teeth look whiter, and I am much happier and more confident.<br /><br />Some people mention issues with putting them on, or taking them off, but it has been a breeze for me. The top and bottom strip are clearly identifiable, and they go on with ease after you understand how they should be aligned. Taking them off is also a breeze if you just start from the ends.<br /><br />You simply use one strip for the top and one for the bottom, once a day. Afterwards, you are left with residual sticky residue which can easily be removed, but it also a great reminder to brush your teeth in case you need that reminder.<br /><br />Great product, albeit a bit pricey, highly worth it if you want whiter teeth for higher self-esteem.

  101. The product I purchased was the [[ASIN:B00336EUTK Crest 3D White Whitestrips With Advanced Seal Professional Effects Enamel Safe Dental Whitening Kit, 20-count Carton]] for about forty bucks. I am in my 50's with no previous teeth whitening experience of any kind. I half-expected some gum sensitivity because these whitestrips are so strong, but I had no problems at all. The strips are easy to apply; they are thick enough that they don't curl up when you remove the backing, the adhesive makes them stick but you can still make minor positioning adjustments, etc. They stay in place with no problem (after all, it's just half an hour). Some reviewers have complained they are too difficult to remove, but it just didn't seem to be a big deal to me.<br /><br />So the real question is: do they work? And the answer is: Yes! Frankly, I was amazed at the difference after three daily applications. I did seven more, but it actually never got much better than it was after three days. The remaining ten strips will be saved for future use if the need arises. Are my teeth totally super white? No, of course not, nor did I realistically expect that. But they are much whiter than they were and I am very pleased indeed. I must add that the areas closer to the gums did not whiten as much, and I was hoping that the last seven treatments would help, but there is still a mile color gradient. Nevertheless, I am very happy with the results and would definitely recommend them to others. The only thing I would do differently is buy a smaller package - twenty strips was overkill for me.

I have decided to continue treatments into a second box since I still am continuing to see a noticeable improvement about every 3 applications. I am still hoping to get to that moviestar white! I've been really using my fingernail to push the strip into the cracks between my teeth and along my lower gumline, hoping to improve the lower teeth - the upper teeth are looking pretty darn good. I'm still waiting for someone (besides my family who all know what I am doing) to comment on my teeth!   135. This product was highly rated, so I gave it a shot and I'm glad I did. I think I'm at treatment number 15 (of 20), and I'll probably just stop now, as my teeth are now the \\"right shade\\" of white. Over-whitening is a bad look, so I like how this product allows you to carefully control how much whitening you achieve. True, going to a dentist for a one-time treatment is quicker, but you don't get the ability to precisely choose how much whitening is best. Also, this way is more gradual, so its less obvious what you've done. Each \\"treatment\\" consists of wearing small plastic sheets on your teeth for 30 minutes. I found it difficult the first time, but after 2 or 3 efforts, I got used to it, and now just do normal activities (watch TV, clean house, read, do email, etc.) during that 30 minutes, so its not a big deal. I haven't had any problems with teeth sensitivity or anything like that. All in all, a really solid product that seems low-risk and is cheaper than going to a dentist or whitening center. Go for it.

  154. I've used the regular Crest Whitestrips before (probably 7 years ago) and they worked well. After switching to a Sonicare toothbrush I noticed that my tooth color had improved, but was still a bit yellow, so decided to try these whitestrips based on the higher active ingredient content. I started by using them two days in a row, and while I've always had teeth that were just a little sensitive to temperature, these made my teeth noticeably more sensitive and a bit uncomfortable (I actually woke up in the middle of the night and the sensitivity was the first thing I noticed). I spaced them out to every other day, which did help, as did adding a toothpaste specifically intended for sensitive teeth. Overall, the result was worth the temporary discomfort.

  173. Crest 3D White Strips<br /><br />Call it a love of coffee and red wine, but my smile really takes a beating. The espresso and zinfandels have plenty of staining power to them, but I think I'd rather stop smiling than give up my consumption of strong dark caffeinated drinks or hearty and succulent wines. A few years ago, I became self-conscious enough about the yellow tinge my teeth were taking on to go through Brite Smile treatment. It was expensive, and frankly, not all that beneficial. Even the every-six month followup treatments didn't really brighten my smile to the point where anyone noticed.<br /><br />Just for grins, (literally) I tried the Crest 3D Whitestrips to see if they could produce any noticeable improvement in the whiteness of my teeth. After trying the strips for several weeks, I'm not impressed. Perhaps consistency is the trick here, as I haven't been able to use them, say, everyday for a week. My use is more sporadic - more like every week. And in between sessions, of course, I'm hitting that espresso machine every morning and bathing my teeth in a glass of rich California wine most nights. But I honestly cannot say that my teeth are any whiter than before I started.<br /><br />The strips are easy to apply, once you figure out how to peel the strip off the clear film encased in a aluminum-like foil pouch. They apply to your teeth quite easily, and are very comfortable. You are supposed to wear them for about a half hour, but it is easy to almost forget that they are 'there' after about five minutes. It is quite possible to wear them and conduct a normal conversation. Peeling them off after the 30 minutes is up is another story. The instructions say not to put them on freshly cleaned teeth and I understand why. They really grip to your enamel and really clean teeth would make them stick even more. It is best to grab a corner of the strip in the back of your mouth and gently pull them off from back to front.<br /><br />The strips also have no noticeable taste. Some bleaching trays have a definite sting to them as the oxygenated bleach work son your gums and imparts a slight bleach taste. The Crest strips, on the other hand have no such taste or irritation on your mouth. I only wish that they worked more effectively. They are not cheap - Amazon sells them at a great price - which works out to a little less than $2 per treatment. But they haven't produced much of a change in the overall whiteness of my teeth,able taste. Some bleaching trays have a definite sting to them as the oxygenated bleach work son your gums and imparts a slight bleach taste. The Crest strips, on the other hand have no such taste or irritation on your mouth. I only wish that they worked more effectively. They are not cheap - Amazon sells them at a great price - which works out to a little less than $2 per treatment. But they haven't produced much of a change in the overall whiteness of my teeth,

Even though I'm a former smoker, I was very lucky that the smoke didn't really discolor my teeth too much. They stay on my teeth, I can talk and go about my normal activities without looking like a rabid dog. There is no disgusting taste, heck I can even drink some water if I want. They don't slide around so I can apply my makeup, do an exercise video, etc... you get the idea. I do use sensitive toothpaste when I use white strips but that is more for peace of mind (I remember the pain) then because I have to... they seem more effective then ever but cause far less sensitivity then I remember in the past.<br /><br />Great experience and I look forward to keeping up with them this time!
  226. It was ship on the date you said . It was 3 weeks after I order it .
  227. I am so happy I tried Crest Whitestrips Professional Effects! It worked as advertised and I now have a white smile! I have so much confidence smiling.   229. After using [[ASIN:B00336EUSG Crest 3D White Vivid Toothpaste Radiant Mint]] for 30 days with barely noticeable results I was not expecting to have any better luck with this product. Thankfully I was wrong and the [[ASIN:B00336EUTK Crest 3D White Whitestrips ]] did exactly what they claim to do.<br /><br />I used the strips in the evening, because I found that it was easy enough to place them on about 30 minutes before bed. I liked that there wasn't any mess putting them on and that the aftertaste was minimal and not bad as some other brands I've tried. One thing I did notice, which was listed as a side effect was \\"sensitivity\\". I have never had this problem, but after 2 days of use my teeth were very sensitive to cold, although after 4 days of use this side effect went away.<br /><br />As for the actual whitening, I thought I noticed results after about 8 days and then on day 17 I had a scheduled dentist appointment and I was surprised that even he noticed that they looked whiter. For me it was more proof that these work and it wasn't just my wishful thinking! I finished up my carton and I'll say that I achieved about 2 shades lighter than when I started. For me that's great and it will be worth the cost to continue using these in the future.

Sure enough, these are strong and very effective. I did experience a little sensitivity from these strips, which was new for me, but it wasn't serious -- I just alternated days for a while, and it was fine. I've gotten many compliments on the color of my teeth lately; the difference is very obvious, and it looks GREAT.   241. I drink a lot of coffee and over the years I realize now why vehicles slow down when I smile, they think the light is turning yellow! These strips do work, somewhat. The can get expensive.<br /><br />You may also get uneven results, with white spots on some teeth where the strip worked better on a high spot. The 3D?   242. Are my teeth whiter? Yes. Was it comparable to the results I get with an in office visit when everything is said and done? No.<br /><br />I like this product, but the professional effects claim was a tall order. I drink a lot of coffee and wanted to use a product that could counteract the staining effect coffee drinking had. It did just that. Perhaps reframing from coffee would have produced more dramatic results, but the product information doesn't suggest this is required. I found this strips to perform up to my intentions, but didn't live up to my hopes. I would use again to maintain a health tooth color, but I would not expect professional results from this product. My in office whitening results where clearly more dramatic and longer lasting when compared to this product. (even after resuming coffee drinking after the required 3 day waiting period in office treatments require) If your looking for general maintenance, I would go with this product, and reserve in office appointments as a treat for when you have disposable income.

  254. The Crest 3D I think are the strongest of the Crest strips. They whiten my teeth with one application, so I use them occasionally when I want the dazzle. They stick on well and as another reviewer has said sometimes to the point that I have to grab on hard using a fingernail to get an edge and using tissue, because my fingers get too slippery, and really pull to remove them. I haven't noticed any harm to my gums. One thing I do is to cut one strip in half lengthwise and use only half on my upper teeth instead of folding the extra width over the edges of my top teeth. I don't seem to need the edges or back whitened and I feel like this helps with my upper teeth sensitivity, plus I can use the other half another time on my upper teeth. I do fold the lower strip over my bottom teeth. Another thing I do is to use the longer strip on my bottom teeth and the shorter strip on my upper teeth (I think they're designed the opposite at least in some of the Crest strips I've used.) I use these strips for maintenance along with my Sonicare with the new sensitive softer brushes. (Thank you Sonicare.) For those with sensitive teeth you might want to try the Sheer White strips. They seem to be as effective, they go on the same way except they are made from more of a beeswax type material that's thicker and sort of stretches and molds, but they are slightly less sensitizing. I cut one in half lengthwise also and get two applications from the one strip for my upper teeth. (If you peel back the packaging on the Sheer Whites to reveal only one strip you can keep the other one viable. I also sometimes use just strip off of the backing of the Crest strips.) I just noticed today, though, that the Sheer White strips are made in China. The Crest strips are made in the USA. Also, the Crest strips don't taste good as another reviewer noted, whereas the Sheer White strips have a sweetish minty flavor.
  255. To begin with I have never used whitening strips before in my life, but have always wanted to try. I ordered these as they were not overly expensive and the majority of the reviews seemed quite positive. The shipping was prompt, the package was in good shape and everything was in order. Now for those of you who were in the same boat as me, wondering if you should take a chance on these, I would say the results are modest. After using them for a solid 20 days straight, my teeth are definitely a shade or two whiter.<br /><br />They will not, however, blow you away with a bright new pearly smile, and some of the images they have on the crest website seem like a bit of an exaggeration. Do they work though? Again, yes, just don't go in expecting too much. Sensitivity can also become an issue, and I did feel some slight pain in my two upper-front teeth, and I had to avoid biting down on apples, drinking beverages that had ice or were just too acidic. It was a minor inconvenience, but an inconvenience nevertheless, and it will take around 1-2 applications before you can feel comfortable wearing the strips on your teeth for 30 minutes. Overall a decent purchase, and probably a step in the right direction if you're looking for a whiter smile, but just keep in mind it will likely take more time and money than what you get through this box alone.

They don't stay on your teeth for the time needed to have the bleach work. Plus, to get them off the sheet of plastic, you'll waste quite a few, because they wrinkle, fold up & go \\"flop\\"- no shape to them at all. They don't dissolve away like the Listerene product.   295. To start - I have worked in dentist offices for a few years, and a couple of my closest friends are top notch dentists. My teeth have always been white, just not white enough for my taste. I like to have a smile that pops. I have had professional whitening done (Britesmile), and these strips are great for maintaining my whiteness. Even if you haven't had that, these should work well for you. Keep in mind that I don't smoke, and I never drink coffee, tea, or colored drinks. If you're someone who always drinks java or things like it, you might not keep your results very long - as anything that can stain a white T-shirt will stain your teeth (but if you brush your teeth a least 2x a day you should be okay;-). The adhesive nature of the strips are great and such an improvement from the previous whitestrips. First and foremost, the most important thing is to make sure your mouth is healthy all together because one can have very white teeth but have underlying issues with gums and decay. If your teeth are particularly sensitive, you might get an occasional \\"zinger\\" when whitening, or your teeth might become more sensitized throughout your whitening process. If this is the case, definitely use a toothpaste like Sensodyne - that should greatly help you. I recommend to apply the strips at least twenty minutes after brushing. I know everyone has different results, but overall you should see improvement. If you're someone with white teeth to begin with, you might get a shade or two lighter, but if your teeth are off white you could be lightened several shades. Another little piece of advice - chew gum (sugar-free of course). Funny thing - for as long as I know every time I see my friends (the dentists) they are always chewing gum in and out of the office. I prefer Orbit or Trident. The action of chewing gum can greatly help your teeth because of the added flow of saliva, which helps inhibit tooth decay. I wish everyone good luck and a happy mouth!

  303. I've used a few other whitening products before. Previously, my preferred product was Crest Night Effects. It was difficult to use, but cheap and effective. I'd tried other strips, but they unpleasant and didn't work as well as the all-night-treatment. Until now!<br /><br />The box contains 20 flat, shiny packets which feel nearly empty. Opening them up (angle your tear down toward the middle of the packet, or the rip-here arrow may just pull the top off and not actually open anything) reveals a sheet of thin, clear, plastic, with two strips that look like tape. They peel off easily, apply trivially, and conform well. At first I wondered if my package was out of date, or something was wrong, because the strips weren't particularly gooey or sticky.<br /><br />Just wait...<br /><br />The whitening gel is dry, and activated by moisture. You want to use dry hands, and don't brush your teeth first. Once those babies get wet, they STICK. In fact, the only challenging thing to the whole process is pulling them off afterward!<br /><br />The instructions say the strips can be used 2x a day, so I did that. As claimed, the whitening was noticeable the third day.<br /><br />As for sensitivity, I was concerned at first. After the second use, my teeth were feeling achey and super sensitive. At that rate, how bad were they going to be by the end? But fortunately, the sensitivity did not continue to get worse. If anything, it leveled off and then improved. This is VERY strong whitener though, and if you have sensitive teeth, be aware you are going to feel that something is going on. It won't do you any harm, but personally, I'd lay off the ice cream for the duration.<br /><br />If you can't handle the increased sensitivity, the instructions advise using the strips at a slower pace, even skipping days.<br /><br />Overall, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

He also mentioned that any kind of professional whitening would in fact make most people's teeth temporarily sensitive prone. He said one good way to handle this is to counter-act it by brushing your teeth with sensitive toothpaste. Since I have stopped using this product my teeth have indeed returned to normal, so I feel more confident in the fact that the sensitivity IS temporary. First off, I personally love the amount of clinginess the strips have. They are a bit hard to adjust after the first few seconds, but you can wear them out and about if necessary. I had to go to the grocery store to pick up the !one! thing I forgot for supper. The strips stayed on the whole time. An additional benefit was that the \\"leftover\\" taste is very neutral and there's little to no stickiness left on your teeth. As far as actual whitening goes, I didn't see much difference between Day 0 and Day 3. It's there, like the infamous difference between ecru and eggshell, but it isn't much. After the whole process, my teeth were significantly whitened. I didn't have sensitivity issues, but I have a feeling that's going to be different for everyone.<br /><br />However, they weren't whitened by as much as I thought they would be. Perhaps the stains from sweet tea and Coke are more durable than most. The majority of my teeth were white, but the closer to the gumline I looked, the more yellow I saw. I did my very best to adhere the strips firmly and evenly, but that gumline wouldn't budge.<br /><br />Overall, my teeth were whitened and whitened very well. The gumline area of yellow is very small and probably only noticable to me. I would order this product again, though I would be extra careful to press the strips down harder.

My teeth hurt the next day after using them and it takes a while to wear off. So I wouldn't reccommend buying a new box the second this one runs out, give your teeth a break.
  360. Any whitening strips sold straight to the public by retailers do not have the actual chemicals that whiten your teeth. These actual whitening products are sold directly and only to certified dentists so that's the only way to actually whiten your teeth. These strips DO NOT work.
  361. I order these strips on a regular basis, I used to smoke and drink coffee and these strips really do make your teeth as white as a $500.00 professional treatment, I like to keep them on hand to maintain my white beautiful teeth
  362. I love Crest White Strips. This is the second time in the last 12 months I use them, and I am always happy with the results. Not sure if the formula/application has been improved but I feel like the strips adhere better and my teeth are less sensitive after the application than the last time I used them. They stay on your teeth better then others on the market and they feel more comfortable as well. Wearing them for only a half an hour is great for me since I can just wear them while I am taking a shower or doing some other activity since they do not get in the way of anything. The gel whitened me teeth after the first application. I have a few white spots on about three of my teeth and they looked a little bit more noticeable as soon as I took off the strips. Within the next hour or so, the white marks started to fade a little bit and the next morning my teeth looked whiter all together, not to mention the white spots did not stand out at all. With the entire box used, my teeth looked like they were professionally done. I do have to mention that I do not drink coffee or red wine and I do not smoke, all in which help my cause. I also go tanning on a regular basis so that also makes my teeth stand out even more. My teeth have always been naturally bright so this product works great since it gives me that extra oomph that I need to have them really stand out. People comment on how white my teeth look at work all the time now. I will say that after using these, your teeth will be a little sensitive, whether it be on their own or when you eat or drink something cold. It did not bother me enough to stop using them however some people might be bothered a lot more. I always say it hurts to be beautiful sometimes and I really do think it is worth suffering the sensitivity for how white your teeth will look once you are done with the entire application. I think they really do give a professional outcome and for the price, it can't be beat by the hundreds of dollars you could be spending at the dentist office for the same results.

The instructions say not to brush your teeth beforehand, but since I used them at night, I always brushed and flossed first, then used the strips, then just peeled them off when done and went to bed, leaving the residue on my teeth overnight. Sensitivity was not an issue, and my gums only got burned a couple of times. There is a technique to applying these strips, especially if your teeth are not perfectly straight. You will get the hang of it after a while. These whitestrips definitely stay on your teeth, no slipping and sliding around. Great value! I'd say give them a try before spending twice as much on gels and trays.

  446. I admit it, I am hooked on coffee. In addition to having teeth that are naturally less than white, I have the resulting caffeine stains from six cups a day of coffee. Unwilling to give up my coffee, I embarked on a journey to find a solution for my less-than-stellar teeth. The combination of Crest's 3D Whitening toothpaste and the strips make a world of difference.<br /><br />I use these strips four times a year to avoid falling too far behind. The strips are easy to apply if you follow the included instructions. The large strip goes on top, the smaller strip goes on the bottom set of teeth. One tip that will improve the ease of use (and, anecdotally, their effectiveness) is to insure that both strips are firmly fitted onto your teeth - on the front side and the back side of the teeth. Once applied, find something to occupy your time for 30 minutes. It's really not that hard if you find a good distraction (and remember to set a timer for 30 minutes). Then lean over your trash can, peel the strips off, and spit out the remaining whitening agent from your mouth. I found that after a week of using these daily my smile was indeed whiter.<br /><br />I did not experience any sensitivity, soreness, or any other adverse reactions to using this product. Highly recommended if you're looking for a reasonably-priced path to a whiter smile.
  447. I have been using Crest Whitening Strips for 6 days. I can see big difference before using this product and after. Now I have much whiter smile.<br />Some people say that they couldn't use whitening strips because of the teeth sensitivity. I personally, don't have such a problem. My teeth are little bit more sensitive than usual but it is not a big deal. It will go away in a couple of days after stopping using this product. If you are looking for alternative to in office teeth whitening, this is definitely a great alternative! Highly recommended!
  448. I like these strips a lot and I use them every couple weeks. I only use them for 3 days in a row, after which I can notice a difference in the whiteness of my teeth, more of a maintenance thing than an instant 20 day 3 shade difference. It takes me about 6 months to use the box generally. I also noticed that some people complain that the strips are too short. I have really big teeth so it only whitens like 6 of my teeth on the bottom. My remedy for this is to stretch the strip out manually before I apply it to my teeth. I tug it so that the strip increases in length but shortens in width. This just means the backs of my teeth are less white, but who the f really cares about the backs of their teeth? All in all, I enjoy this product. BTW amazon definitely has the best price.

A secret I learned a few years back to illustrate the rather subtle bleaching process -- try bleaching your top teeth first for a few days and see the contrast between top and bottom. It really is amazing and will make you want to continue the whitening process.

  500. I had used the classic Crest white strips happily several times in the past, but this time decided to try these updated ones. I'm not sold on the change. Like the originals, these 3D strips improved the whiteness of my teeth starting at about 3 days, but I wasn't prepared for the difference in application. Like the original, this version comes mounted on a clear plastic support card from which you carefully peel it. On this product, tops and bottoms are mounted on the same plastic, unlike the separates in the classic strips. The strips are tougher material which do not slide around easily on your teeth but grab hold strongly. The first time I tried to take them back off I became a little nervous because it was hard to get them to let go! You really have to work at it compared to the older ones. I did get them off, but even after brushing, tiny bits of rubbery adhesive keep turning up in my mouth. This didn't happen with the original.<br /><br />You can't really speak clearly with these things in your mouth, although the phone inevitably rings when I am doing this. I always want to get them off as soon as possible, so I don't need a product I can drink water and sleep in.<br /><br />The packaging is aggravating, but that is true in both versions. You peel off a foil outer package--which doesn't come off cleanly--and try to remove the inner plastic with the strips without tearing anything. The strips themselves look about like the clear plastic they are mounted on so they are hard to see; don't put them down on your counter since they will be hard to find again! Such an expensive product should have better designed packaging.

While waiting for the Whitestrips to arrive, I started brushing my teeth with ProNamel by Sensodyne as I was already experiencing some occassional tooth sensitivity. Just prior to putting on the Whitestrips I brush with ProNamel and immediately after taking the strips off I brush again with ProNamel. So far I've been able to wear the strips every day without any sensitivity to the product.   547. The package claims that you can see visible whitening after only 3 days. This claim is true. I've never whitened my teeth before but they weren't too yellow to begin with and I noticed the difference after 3 days exactly. However, I also have sensitive teeth and by the third day, the strips had increased their sensitivity. The instructions say that if your teeth are sensitive, start using the strips every other day (instead of every day), so that's what I did. The sensitivity stopped immediately after skipping a day. I used the rest of the package in a similar manner: using the strips every other day, sometimes using them two days in a row. The whitening continued just fine using this method. My teeth are extremely clean looking now, but not that fluorescent look some people get with over-whitening. They just look pretty and clean.<br /><br />A few notes on usage. The strips are easy to apply, especially if you follow the instructions and put the bottom one on first. I definitely recommend, as the package says, to use them BEFORE you brush your teeth. The instructions say it will reduce tooth sensitivity but there's also another benefit: if you use them daily before you brush your teeth, you won't forget to do it AND you can brush off the gooey stuff that the strips leave behind on your teeth. Also, the strips are EXTREMELY sticky. They won't come off accidentally; they stay on securely. They are comfortable to wear. When you pull them off, make sure your fingers are dry so you can get a good grip to pull off the strip.

  564. This is an excellent product. I went in thinking/expecting that these were not going to work and that the improvement was going to be so minimal it was barely going to be worth it. I received it super fast and tried my first strip right away. They adhere to your teeth perfectly and don't switch or move. Think of it as glue that actually stays put. It doesn't taste bad either, though I wouldn't recommend drinking anything (even though it says water is OK, I really don't think you would want to). Taking them off was equally as easy, and although it does leave a strip of clear film behind, you can just rinse your mouth twice or three times and you're done. Results were clearly visible in 3 days, and boy, what a difference! Things just keep getting better and better the more you use them. Just make sure you REALLY read the instructions and adhere to their guidelines. I left mine on for about two hours (fell asleep with them, figures) and my teeth were very sensitive for about a week. I didn't use them for that week, and they were pretty much back to normal. The sensitivity isn't dead painful either. You just cant drink very cold, very hot liquids unless you put your tongue behind your lower teeth (these were the ones to develop the most sensitivity). It may make more sense if you try them, but my point is, it wasnt ALL that bad at all. The product says to use them as fast as possible, but I still have about 8 strips left and I don't see much harm in not being able to use them all in the least amount of time. 20 strips for sure are enough to do the job.<br /><br />Only (initially) bad thing was the price. But once you see the results, how easy and simple it is, you will think you just got a deal on a $500+ product. I can't talk about the durability yet, but during the week I had them off, I didnt see any negative changes. Absolutely recommend these over all other brands I've seen girlfriends use, that are so thin and flimsy and move around in their mouth if they do as much as swallow or sneeze, let alone drink anything.ch as swallow or sneeze, let alone drink anything.

  567. I was meaning to try this product for ages and finally decided to go through with it as I have my first post-college career job starting soon. I actually saw some results after my FIRST application of pro effects...but here is a warning (that has been posted in many other reviews...)<br /><br />5 minutes into my first application I got an incredibly sharp pain in the dead center of one of my top teeth. I'm talking like stabbing exposed nerve kinda pain. I'm one to get cavities drilled without novacane, and I have quite a high tolerance for pain but this was like the equivalent of sticking a fork in an outlet. It wasn't bad enough that I felt the need to remove the strips, but I definitely wasn't expecting that type of pain. It played out exactly like some other reviews state; pain fades quickly and then randomly returns now and then. Unlike some others though I had NO pain after removing the strips, and no pain in the following hours etc. This scenario played out almost my entire first week using the strips, but by the time I got towards the last 5 or so treatments I would just get a tingling sensations that felt as if the pain was approaching the 'ouch!' tipping point but didn't make it over the hill. For the comparatively small price tag i'm very pleased, these strips weren't goopy and stayed on my teeth very well.

  573. Please don't be stupid like I was and apply it for full 30 minutes till your dentin gets exposed to acids from food and you get a toothache. My teeth started hurting 20 minutes in (go the &#34;sensitivity&#34;), but I decided to wait out full 30. My teeth bleached really well after just the first use, and I don't see any reason to be using it for a set amount of time or every day. Not like the teeth are going to get stained overnight or something. Do yourself a favor and apply it only till you start feeling pain, and then if you do get pain, wait out several days till it's completely gone and your enamel is more or less restored. Personally, I'd use it for 15 minutes at a time once a week. It's pretty strong.

  594. To keep sensitivity to a minimum, take my advice and that of other reviewers -<br /><br />1. Start using Original Sensodyne (not Sensodyne Whitening) or any \\"for sensitive teeth\\" toothpaste a week before you start the strips and continue for as long as you do the strips.<br /><br />2. Do a set of strips every *other* day. This is what I did and I'm very pleased. It takes 40 days instead of 20, but I don't care because my teeth didn't hurt and are whiter. Had the sensitivity been too bad I would have quit using the strips and still have my coffee stained teeth.<br /><br />3. Be realistic. This box contains peroxide gel, not porcelain veneers.

  605. Let's just get to the point... these strips work.<br /><br />PROS:<br />Strips easy to apply<br /> Only wear them for 30 minutes each day<br /> Inexpensive compared to dental procedures<br /><br />CONS:<br />20 consecutive days to complete process<br /> Can make teeth and gums raw or sensitive<br /><br />After 3 days, you WILL see a slight change in your teeth. It will be very, VERY subtle. You might be the only one who can tell. But a week after that, you start to shine! And after the 20 days, your teeth are CLEARLY WHITER than when you started the treatment. I grew tired of putting the strips on after a couple of weeks. But I just kept going to get the complete treatment. It's worth it!<br /><br />My teeth did get a little bit sensitive after about 10 days or so. But it never caused me pain - just some tenderness. I did develop a tiny raw spot above one of my teeth on the gum line just above the tooth. It showed up at the very end in the last week. It was red and sensitive, but not serious. If the strips touch your gums, they will get red or maybe even bleed. So try to make sure the entire strip touches teeth only.<br /><br />My advice for application is this...<br /><br />1. Brush your teeth<br />2. Rinse well with water<br />3. Use tissue to dry upper row of teeth<br />4. Apply upper strip to dry teeth<br />5. Use tissue to dry lower row of teeth<br />6. Apply lower strip to dry teeth<br />7. Remove strips after 30 minutes<br />8. Brush teeth lightly and rinse thoroughly<br /><br />That's it. Do that for 20 days and you WILL have whiter teeth.

  610. I purchased a similar item from this seller, and though the box arrived a little smashed (I actually blame my mailman. He drop-kicks my packages all the time), it was exactly what he'd claimed it was.<br /><br />As for the product itself...I have terrible teeth. They stain incredibly easily, even though I brush faithfully, and they're stupidly sensitive. Even a regular cleaning from the dentist sends me through the roof, and it's gotten to the point where the dentist makes me come half an hour early just so he can put on something to numb my teeth before the cleaning even starts. I'm not exactly a wuss, but every time I've tried to bleach my teeth in the past, the gel made my teeth hurt so badly that I wouldn't be able to talk or eat for a day or so afterwards. I gave up on bleaching years ago, because I just couldn't stand it.<br /><br />My sister--who has invincible, blindingly white teeth--told me to try this. Now, I'd tried many other products over the years, and most of them didn't produce results quickly enough to make the inevitable pain worthwhile. I wasn't expecting much from the Crest strips, but they really made all the difference. My teeth became noticeably whiter after two uses, and each time I use them, they go a shade lighter.<br /><br />Sensitivity is still an issue. I can't use the strips more than twice a week, if that, so whitening is still a major process for me. Still, the sensitivity isn't even remotely as bad with these strips as it has been with other products. I can still speak and eat and function, which is a huge plus.<br /><br />I have, however, heard that the Professional Effects is easier on sensitive teeth than even other Crest products. I've never tested the others, but I went with these just to be on the safe side.

  615. I started by using the first Crest Whitestrips that came out. I would say there was not much improvement, and the lower strip wouldn't stay in place because saliva collects there. When Crest offered an &#34;advanced&#34; system I decided to give the newer line a try. By this time I happened to have a flexible lower teeth mold from my dentist from some work done there. The whitestrips made a big difference, and they stayed in place on lower teeth because I slipped the mold on over the lower strip. I always use these exactly as the package directs. Do not brush your teeth before applying the strips. I wait a bit until after I remove them to brush. Now my routine includes using the &#34;Professional Effects&#34; about every 6 months. My dentist and hygienist noticed right away that my teeth were whiter and brighter. Their whitening system is so much more expensive so I am thrilled that the Crest product works for me. By the end of the cycle of use I do have a little tenderness in my gums but I just skip a day if so.
  616. In the past, I have tried Listerine whitening strips and Rembrandt 2-Hour. My husband (age 57 and a coffee drinker), has tried products from our dentist with the tray and bleaching product called Nite White. Nite White only whitened his teeth about one shade. We were not happy with that result and ordered twice, thinking the first one was bad or near expiration. Second one didn't do anything either. On Nite White, he went from the light brown stage to a very dark yellow stage - not much improvement at all...in fact barely noticeable. He seemed to want to give up on the process, but I convinced him to just try the strips and now he's preferring them to the tray treatments.<br /><br />So I happened to find a $10 coupon in the mailers and said what the heck, and picked these up at Target. They were $49.99 there, so kind of pricey, but we didn't want to try Nite White any more and have another poor result.<br /><br />With the Crest 3D Professional Effects, and after 4 strips, he is now seeing very marked improvement. He is happy to finally be seeing a true result and wants to continue with his progress. I tried them once and had improvement already. One box will certainly be enough for both of us. They adhere well to the teeth, and when removing just start on one side at the back and pull around to the other side.<br /><br />We use Sensodyne to help reduce the sensitivity that may occur. I did have some sensitivity even after one strip - but my husband hasn't had any, but he uses Sensodyne daily. Common sense prevails and always consult your dentist to make sure you can use this product safely. We always get regular cleanings and checkups. We both love the results we are seeing.

  627. These are by far the best over the counter white strips I have ever used. I literally started to see results not by day 3, but by day 2, and continue so see incremental improvements since. I have approx 5-6 days remaining. Unlike past products, these not only have superior whitening power, but they actually stay in place!! so much so that I sometimes need to peel them off my teeth with my fingernail. (previous products would slip and slide all the time). Of note, these have caused some sensitivity for me but not like previous products used. Furthermore, my experience is unusual in that I have fallen asleep with the strips on, for as long as 2 1/2 hrs. (shame on me!). I would expect that the sensitivity would be far less or none at all if I would use as directed (1/2 hr. only). Don't let the price dissuade you, these are worth it if you want noticeable and fast results. I recommend using sensodyne toothpaste before, during and probably after use. I also started using arm and hammer age defying toothpaste, has liquid calcium to strengthen enamel, and seems to have helped with sensitivity so far. Thank you Crest for such an amazing product for my [previously yellow] teeth! A++++++++++++
  628. Does this product whiten your teeth? ABSOLUTELY. I have used Crest Whitening strips in the past (about 5 years ago) and did see a small difference, however my teeth were slightly sensitive to said product, but I pushed through the pain. However, after trying ONE set of strips (upper and lower) for one 30 minute session, I can NEVER try them again. Four hours later, I was in such intense pain that I could not unclench my face. The Crest Professional Strips are amazing for whitening, even after the single 30 minute session I saw a small difference, so I can imagine what using an entire set would do, but caution users, if you have sensitive teeth, this is NOT the product for you. The pain lasted for 12+ hours in my case and had strange effects on me. I could not touch cotton for example, clothes, couch, pillows, etc. Teeth sensitive have been related to skin sensitivity, and it became so bad that it felt like the \\"nails-on-a-chalkboard\\" feeling whenever I thought of or got near cotton. And no, this has never happened to me before. It took a lot of pain medication and Orajel to just relax at all. I finally had to contact an emergency doctor to make sure I wasn't having an allergic reaction (I was not). So, as I said, if your teeth aren't sensitive GO FOR IT! This product is amazing! But beware if you have experienced any sensitivity, it can lead to a horrible horrible experience! Good luck buyers ;-)
  629. I have been using them for about a week so far.   632. I've been using it for about 5 days and have noticed some change. I've read other reviews and noticed people saying the sensitivity is insane! I have a suggestion for that though. Also if i breathe in with my mouth there is also slight pain. So what I recommend is to put the strips on while your taking your 15 mins shower and keep spitting and also breathe in with your nose. As a result, I now feel almost no pain. It makes leaving the strips on your teeth for 30 mins much much easier. My girlfriend has noticed my whiter smile, so I gotta say this product does work. During my third use, I felt a sharp pain through one of my teeth. Finished the session, took the strip off. About 10 minutes later, felt a sharper pain, went to the mirror to see a crack going from top to bottom on one of my teeth. Went to the dentist this morning, he said it's not uncommon because the Whitening Strips soften the teeth and can make them brittle. Be careful with Whitening Strips.

  654. Just take a moment to cosider this...you are putting BLEACH on your teeth. Some people have bad reactions, some people don't. Sensitivy is NORMAL. For some it may be a little more extreme, but you can't expect to put BLEACH on your teeth with no reaction whatsoever. Think about this...Clorox Bleach isn't even supposed to come in contact with your HANDS without you washing them right after because it is an IRRITANT. Just because your teeth hurt doesn't mean that it ate away all your enamel. It means the BLEACH penetrated through the layers of your teeth (exactly what it is supposed to do to whiten them) and your teeth got sore from it, because yes, teeth do have nerves, and BLEACH being an IRRITANT effected those nerves. The sensitivity goes away when you stop using the product because you are no longer putting this irritant, BLEACH, on your TEETH. Maybe you should have considered using an enamel strengthening toothpaste for a few weeks PRIOR to (and after) putting BLEACH on them...
  655. They whiten well but I find they irritate my teeth after application. The following day or the day of, there is a scratching sensation on my teeth. I read the instructions and didn't brush before application but it continues to irritate.

  689. They do work! Just a summary of what you should do to make this most effective with the least pain.<br /><br />- Follow the instructions!<br />- Don't brush before using the strips<br />- Use Sensodyne Pro-Namel for at least 3-7 days before the strips<br />- When using the strips, keep them on for AT MOST 30 mins<br />- Don't try to eat, drink, or talk too much when you are wearing these<br />- Swish your mouth with water after use (the gel will be stuck to your teeth if used correctly, so rinse it off afterwards)<br /><br />Like I said, beauty is pain. After you remove the strips your mouth will feel a little odd and some say that the strips are harmful for your teeth but I'm not a dentist so I am not sure about the effects. Overall good product for the cost.

  722. I simply love this product. This is my second time ordering this through Amazon. It's priced right and cheaper compared to a brick and mortar store.<br /><br />I use these strips about once a week now. Before, I used them every day. Because I drink a lot of coffee, my two front teeth would begin to turn yellow. So, instead of wasting an entire strip on just my two front teeth (my other teeth remain white), I came up with this cool idea. I take one pack and proceed to cut the upper in 4 equal sections. Then I cut the lower in 3 equal sections (The lower is shorter in length, and wider compared to the upper since there are two strips per pack). This way, I can just whiten my two front teeth and then this strip lasts me 1 week (daily use) before I have to open a new pack. Now that I'm whitening my front teeth once a week, one pack will last me 7 weeks. Make sense? ;o)<br /><br />I will continue to buy these and I'm very pleased with the product.

  752. This is my first time using whitestrips. I was a bit skeptical and didn't want to waste my money on more white products that promised to work but didn't (toothpaste, mouth rinses, etc.). Since I found a good deal on these whitestrips, decided to give it a go and I am now on Day 5 and getting compliments from my kids who did not know I was using them. My teeth were yellow, I didn't like smiling, but now I've been doing the smiley dance in the mirror. My teeth were already sensitive, and by the 7th hour after taking the strips off my teeth will throb for about 5 hours tops, then the pain goes away, but it's not that unbearable toothache pain that has you reaching for the meds, at least not for me. Yesterday (Day 4) my teeth didn't throb like they usually do, just an ache here or there, so I'm hoping that is the end of it. If not, I can bear it till I reach that level of whiteness. The strips stay on and don't slide off. I can also talk with them on, but I prefer not to. I use Sensodyne toothpaste, and as always I stay away from very cold food. Thanking the Lord I finally found something that works!
  753.   754. This morning was the second day. WoW! It's deffinately Crest's best whitening kit they have for retail as I've used thier lower priced kit,Rembrant and a $350 Dentist's Kit which all of them took the entire package to do JUST an ok job. I will say that the $350 kit I used from the dentist has been the worst kit I've used. Dentist's like to take a mold of your teeth and make you feel like this does some kind of magic making thier whitening product work better than Crest's ... it doesn't and I know plently of you have seen terrible results like this. Follow my direction below and I will save you $300! The only good part of the mold of your teeth and using the gels is that you get more coverage to your rear teeth but \\"IF\\" you do my routine below, you'll have healthy back teeth that are white enough.<br /><br />The formula Crest uses in this product doesn't irratate my gums or make them feel that nerve type of tingle that's annoying which I've experienced with all whitening kits. Because there hasn't been irritation like I described, I've been waring them for 40 minutes instead of 30 minutes as I was afraid they were either too old or were not working. Nope! This product works better than the $350 kit and the others mentioned above!<br /><br />I want to add that I haven't had a cavity in over 8 years and I'm 35 years old.<br /><br />The bottom line PEOPLE is that you can't stick your toothbrsh in your mouth just for 30-60 seconds in the morning and 30-60 seconds at night and think that your teeth are going to to just be as white as a babys and you're gums are going to be healthy as well!!!<br /><br />I had coffee stains in between my teeth about 5 years ago and I thought my teeth were rotting out. I brushed for about 2 minutes twice a day but I never worked the toothpaste into my teeth because I always applied the toothpaste to the toothbrush's brissles. That's the wrong way to do it and after I thought about the process of 30 years of brushing my teeth, I changed my way of doing the job as explained below.<br /><br />1st ... apply a liberal amount of toothpaste to the tip of your tongue and allow your tongue to apply the toothpaste to every part of all of your teeth, front and back pushing the toothpaste in between your teeth. You can even let the toothpaste just sit on your teeth for 30-60 seconds before brushing. This is the only way to make use of all the toothpaste instead of having that toothpaste being pushed to the bottom of your brissles which difficult to wash out, if you wash it all out at all when done brushing. How do you suppose your toothbrush can dry properly if you have toothpaste stuck to the bottom the brissles? It can't and that in itself breed bacteria because it can't dry. Do you really like sticking that toothbrush in your mouth seeing this mornings old toothpaste still on it? Of course you don't and if you do, then somethings wrong with you! So apply the toothpaste to the tip of your tongue, not to the tooth brush's brissles!<br /><br />Then take your toothbrush (I use a medium Colgate) and slowly work those brissles in between each tooth feeling the brissles actually going in between each tooth and into your gum line. It's not a race! I get sick of seeing ppl brush thier teeth like it's a 50k Sprint! I do not understand how these people think that brushing your teeth at 100 MPH for 20 seconds does the job!?!?! This is a major reason people have bad breath and teeth that look like the person is doing meth.<br /><br />Make sure you floss once a day after you brush your teeth and before you use your mouthwash and don't make that a race either. You really got to work that floss (I use the waxed REACH Cinnamon brand) like you're buffing the finish on your new paint job and don't forget to get into the gumline. How can you buff a tooth with anything but the waxed floss? The string type just removes debris and the tape floss just folds up. Either way use floss once a day!<br /><br />Rinse with a mouth wash twice a day (I use Listerine or generic and I like it HOT!!!). I don't believe the non alcohol rinses do the same good job as the alcohol rinses. I look at the ingredients. Either way, use a mouthwash of some sort. One thing I've noticed about mouthwashes is that the dyes in them can leave your teeth slighlty stained so I recommend you switch your colors of mouth wash each time you buy a new bottle. One month I'll use cool mint, the next cinnamon, the next the yellow one, etc. I wish they'd make a clear Listerine that had the alcohol in it like Crest's Clear non-alcohol mouthwash.<br /><br />When you use your mouthwash, DON'T make that a 10 second race either. Use as directed which is usually for 30 seconds.<br /><br />\\"IF\\" and I SAY \\"IF\\" YOU use Crest's 3D Toothpaste and do what I explain to you for 10 days, it'll look like you have a new grill.<br /><br />THEN AND ONLY THEN ..... after the 1st ten days of your new brushing,flossing and rinsing routine have started then use these Crest WHite Strips and it'll look like you went to a Hollywood Dentist and paid $1000.<br /><br />NOTE:!!!! If you are not a regular floss user flossing daily like I explain above and you don't brush your teeth properly like I explain how to above or use mouthwash twice a day like I explained above ..... then ....<br /><br />I suggest waiting 30-45 days after doing the above proper way of brushing/flossing/rinsing routine BEFORE using the Crest White Strips because your gums need to get used to being flossed properly and brushed properly. If your gums are not healthy, don't expect to put any whitening strips on and not have your gums get irritated with the nerve tingling feeling which is very uncomfortable. If you can't handle the the stips for 30 minutes as directed DON'T EXPECT THE PRODUCT TO WORK!!!<br /><br />I also suggest using this kit 2-3 times a year \\"IF\\" YOU TAKE CARE OF YOUR MOUTH!!!<br /><br />Good luck!<br /><br />Update!!!<br /><br />I used them for 8 days in a row. I can't see how my teeth can get any whiter so I'm using the rest as a touch-up which I'm doing by using one package once or twice a week.<br /><br />Update 2-5-2012<br />I'm buying this product for a 2nd time. I have a months worth of Hawaii time coming and I will use half of the stips to make sure my smile is Hollywood perfect!wice a day (I use Listerine or generic and I like it HOT!!!). I don't believe the non alcohol rinses do the same good job as the alcohol rinses. I look at the ingredients. Either way, use a mouthwash of some sort. Use as directed which is usually for 30 seconds.<br /><br />\\"IF\\" and I SAY \\"IF\\" YOU use Crest's 3D Toothpaste and do what I explain to you for 10 days, it'll look like you have a new grill.<br /><br />THEN AND ONLY THEN ..... after the 1st ten days of your new brushing,flossing and rinsing routine have started then use these Crest WHite Strips and it'll look like you went to a Hollywood Dentist and paid $1000.<br /><br />NOTE:!!!!   774. I got a sample of Crest 3D White Whitestrips. It came with one upper and one lower strip. They're pretty pricey, even with the $10 coupon included in my package. They're very easy to use. Just brush your teeth, dry them off, peel off the strips and apply them tightly to your upper and lower teeth. The directions state to leave them on for 30 minutes. Since I have crooked teeth it was hard to be sure I got every tooth covered, but the strips are very sticky, so it wasn't too difficult. I wore them while I did some work online and found that they made my mouth more watery than usual. They also taste like peroxide. For anyone who's used the tooth whitening gels you'll know what I mean.<br /><br />When I took the strips off I was left with some product residue on my teeth, but I just rinsed my mouth and it came right off. One tooth felt especially sensitive after using this product, which bugged me for a few hours. What about the whitening? My teeth did seem slightly whiter after one use, though the package clearly states that better results are seen after three uses.<br /><br />Are they worth the price? Well, they're much cheaper than having the dentist do it and the strips are much less messy than the gels, they also work faster than the whitening toothpastes. The website also states that they're safe for teeth and won't wear down the enamel. If you really want white teeth I would highly recommend the Crest 3D White Whitestrips since they're fast and convenient. However, don't expect super white teeth right away.
  775. I wasn't terribly optimistic about how well these would work. I only bought them since they were on sale and decided to give them a shot. I recently quit smoking and was giving myself a kind of \\"bodily makeover\\", but I don't have infinite funds to spend and can't afford a professional job. I'm only about halfway through the carton and I have better results already than I expected- which was little to none. But they aren't without their pitfalls.<br /><br />The upsides: you do see results fairly quickly and they aren't a big problem in terms of time to use them or very difficult to use and comfortable enough to wear. I only had a couple of times where they folded in on themselves while I was applying and had to pull them apart a little wet, but they were still usable. I dry my teeth with a piece of cotton and brush/floss just before I apply to make sure there isn't anything in the way of good adhesion. A word of warning, once they are stuck, they are stuck. It's not easy to reposition them after they are pressed onto your teeth, so you have to do it right the first time.<br /><br />The downsides: they can cause some sensitivity and gum irritation. I personally didn't find it too troublesome and the tooth sensitivity faded after a few days even while continuing to use them. As I understand it, not everyone has the same experience and it is too bothersome for some people to continue use. My gums are a bit irritated in spots, but honestly I've lost track of time on a few occasions when wearing them and had them in a lot longer than recommended. So had I only worn them for the recommended 30 minutes, that might not be such a problem. On the other hand, that showed how comfortable they can be, if I could totally forget about them for well over an hour.<br /><br />They can be difficult to get in between the teeth. I usually use a fingernail to push them between my teeth a bit. I've noticed that where there isn't good direct contact like between teeth and right at the gumline, it is less white. Also, I have flourodosis spots on my teeth. So my teeth naturally have a lot of white splotches and while these help to blend those in better, they will not go away- something I vaguely hoped for, but didn't expect.<br /><br />I also found that when I have bad dry mouth, they are more uncomfortable to use. I initially thought I could wear them while on my treadmill and that didn't fly. The exertion combined with these odd tasting plastic sheets on my teeth and needing to drink lots of water, just wasn't going to work and was really uncomfortable. You can sip water during use, but I've found a good sized gulp will destroy the adhesion and taste terrible. Considering the cost, you don't really want to waste any of them.<br /><br />Lastly, don't expect perfectly bright white teeth like you would see in a commercial and I'm not confident it is truly \\"professional level whitening\\" in a box. In fact, those are usually either caps or veneers- in other words, they aren't even real teeth. If you have any artificial dental work, these won't change the color of it, you will need replacement for that. Also, it will depend on what you are starting with as to how white they will get. If you are starting with heavily stained teeth from years of smoking, coffee and soda drinking, etc., you might just want to pop for the professional job at the dentist's office since this will only take them up a few shades. On that note, I was told by a dentist friend that post professional whitening, one should avoid the big teeth stainers- cigarettes, coffee, dark teas and sodas for 2 weeks. Otherwise, you tend to reverse all the work that was done. In order to try and get the best results I can, I've been avoiding all those during use, so that could be helping to get better results, I can't be sure. I'd rather go overboard and get better results than risk not getting the most for my money because of something that could have been easily avoided. And it doesn't cost a cent to avoid those things. Annoying perhaps, but monetarily speaking, that is something you can do at home without spending a dime or second of your time and there are other obvious health benefits to cutting out those things.<br /><br />I was also using the Crest 3D white toothpaste prior to using this product and will continue to do so. It has a minor effect, but takes a very long time for even slight results. That also might be increasing results somewhat, but again, I can't be sure. I just figure it can't hurt. You still have to brush anyway, right?<br /><br />Bottom line, the product works, just don't expect that a do-it-yourself carton is going to make your teeth look like a movie star's. If that is truly what you're after and any less is a disappointment, see a cosmetic dentist for an all over professional job and you'll likely need some artificial work done since very few people have such perfect or white teeth naturally.o avoid those things. Annoying perhaps, but monetarily speaking, that is something you can do at home without spending a dime or second of your time and there are other obvious health benefits to cutting out those things.<br /><br />I was also using the Crest 3D white toothpaste prior to using this product and will continue to do so. It has a minor effect, but takes a very long time for even slight results. That also might be increasing results somewhat, but again, I can't be sure. I just figure it can't hurt. You still have to brush anyway, right?<br /><br />Bottom line, the product works, just don't expect that a do-it-yourself carton is going to make your teeth look like a movie star's. If that is truly what you're after and any less is a disappointment, see a cosmetic dentist for an all over professional job and you'll likely need some artificial work done since very few people have such perfect or white teeth naturally.
  776. I'm a white smile obsessive. I've done Zoom! whitening twice in this decade (clearly, its results are not lasting, but it does get teeth really white). I've always had great success with Crest Whitestrips and this version is as good if not better. It gets my teeth just as white as Zoom whitening, although not as fast. Because it works more gradually, ppl may not necessarily think they get their teeth as white as a professional whitening, but my personal opinion is that it is just as effective when used as instructed.<br /><br />My first complaint is that the effect of the Crest Whitestrips wore off more quickly on me (after a few months) than professional whitening (after a year and a half?). My second complaint is that I have serious teeth sensitivity when using this product (i don't normally have sensitive teeth), which makes it sometimes slightly painful to follow the whitening schedule as proscribed. If you do have sensitive teeth, I would definitely caution against using this product; but if you do, I would do it very slowly. I also had teeth sensitivity with Zoom Whitening, but it wasn't as lasting. However, on my second Zoom treatment, I got severe burns on my gums which were waaay more painful (and ugly) than the teeth sensitivity ever was.<br /><br />I'll trade the pain and the extra high cost for the affordable and effective Crest Whitestrips. Thanks!

  791. My teeth are very straight, so I get a good fit and therefore good results. Once they are on, they immediately begin to work (you can see them foaming if you smile at yourself). That said, getting rid of all stains in between teeth may be an issue, if the strips cannot adhere well due to teeth not being straight.<br /><br />When used the first time, I recommend using them as indicated, although this will make your teeth sensitive. I do not typically have any trouble with sensitivity, and using these as directed made my teeth ache with sensitivity--so just be aware of this.<br /><br />Now I keep a box in my bathroom and use a top/bottom set once or twice a month for maintenance.<br /><br />Again, everyone is different, so results will vary. I am very happy with these. Been using them for over 10 yrs, and the newer fit is a definite improvement. I can take a drink of water or read to my kids while using them, and they don't slip at all. In fact, you have to tug to get them off when you are done.<br /><br />I also use the Crest whitening toothpaste (unless my teeth are sensitive) in between treatments. Using these, along with obsessively good dental hygiene, keeps my teeth looking great! :)

  855. I can't express how thrilled I am knowing of this product. I'm an uber insecure teenager who had yellow teeth for reasons my younger self regrets. Take note: HAD. Long story short, it made my banana colored teeth to a more decent color. Love it!!
  856. I've used Whitestrips before, around 10 years ago, but had a couple of problems: They didn't stick to my teeth reliably, and they gave me painful &#34;zingers&#34; in my teeth. This product is a big improvement. They do grip as advertised (with an exception; see below) and they don't give me zingers. Disclosure: I started brushing with Sensodyne because I knew I'd be using them, so maybe that makes the difference. They do cause slight dull pain in my teeth. I'm okay with that.<br /><br />They are sticky enough that you will want to brush and rinse after taking them out to get the bleach gel off your teeth.<br /><br />As for the whitening, yes, they're working. They do require some patience, especially from those who have decades of stains to remove. They are not going to give you the obvious-the-same-day results you get from Zoom whitening in a dentist's office. But it's a 20-treatment package. If you keep using them for the entire 20 treatments you should see a difference.<br /><br />Two things to be aware of: The thinner parts of your teeth are likely to bleach faster than the thicker parts, so for a while you may have disconcertingly two-toned teeth, part white, part yellow. Just keep using them. The thicker parts will eventually whiten, too. And if like me you have decades of &#34;insults&#34; to bleach out of your teeth (lots and lots of black tea in my case) you need to take the label literally: &#34;Removes 14 years of stains.&#34; I'm turning 56... figure my permanent teeth came in when I was 8, so these teeth are 48 years old... but I've used whitening products before... it might take three or four boxes of these things to remove 48 years of accumulated staining. I'm okay with that too.<br /><br />One star off for manufacturing issues. These problems arose in my first week of treatment: One lower strip simply didn't stick, period. Slippery, where all the rest have been sticky, as if it didn't get a layer of something it was supposed to get. Another upper strip didn't peel off the backing -- the backing came apart and stuck to it, as if the backing had been punched in the same shape. Took a few minutes of wrestling to get the strip off the stiff plastic. Annoying. So far, I'm getting a manufacturing defect like this about every third packet of strips. That's kind of a lot.trip didn't peel off the backing -- the backing came apart and stuck to it, as if the backing had been punched in the same shape. Took a few minutes of wrestling to get the strip off the stiff plastic. Annoying. So far, I'm getting a manufacturing defect like this about every third packet of strips. That's kind of a lot.

  859. I'm a dental hygiene student and my teacher suggested we all try white strips at least once so we could inform our patients more about them. Only bad part is that I have a pretty large smile and they do not cover all of my teeth that are exposed while smiling. I could see it being a problem of your teeth were stained a darker shade and the ones it covered were lightened dramatically. Overall I'd suggest these.

Those with sensitive teeth do need to be careful - the first time I used them, I had pain in my teeth after about a week of daily use. I also have some gum recession, and I need to be very careful to not place the strips on my exposed root.   894. Despite reading all the other negative reviews about how Crest Whitestrips causes pain in the teeth after a couple of uses, I decided to purchase this product anyway. The first time I used it, everything worked great, the strips fit on my teeth nicely, they stayed on well, they didn't leave any gel behind, they didn't taste funny, nothing hurt, etc. so I figured my teeth must not be of the sensitive type. Well the product says to use it every day for 20 days straight, but I waited about a week between my first and second uses (because I kept forgetting about them). I put them on again today (for my second use) and about five minutes in, I felt this sharp pain in one of my lower teeth that lasted about a second. I immediately took off the bottom strip, but left the top one on since it was still feeling fine. About five minutes later, one of my top teeth also felt the same pain and I took the top strip off as well. My teeth feel fine and I haven't felt that pain again since taking off the strips, but it definitely scared me a lot, since I didn't want them to crack or anything. I think I might try using this product once a month and maybe that will whiten my teeth slightly without causing any sort of pain. My teeth feel pretty normal at this point, maybe slightly more sensitive to ice than usual, but no more side effects at this point.

  900. I bought a box of Crest 3D Whitestrips Professional Effects thinking that it would improve the whiteness of my teeth somewhat. The strips were easy to apply and bend around the teeth. They stayed on with no slippage and no leakage. They contain hydrogen peroxide which is the bleaching agent. You can taste the peroxide a little bit but is no bother at all. I had zero problems with sensitivity but if you do, try using Sensodyne Pro Enamel toothpaste after removing the strips. I had no burning of the gums either. I kept the strips on for about 1 hour each day, removed them and brushed my teeth. Day by day, the teeth kept getting whiter. I bought a second box recently and will use them occasionally to keep my teeth white. It is the easiest and the least expensive method I can think of. If you want whiter teeth, go for it.   955. I got these whitestrips and started using them about two weeks ago. I was worried about tooth sensitivity, as I had done whitestrips before and gotten those shooting tooth pains, so I read some other reviews and decided to use Sensodyne toothpaste. I started that about a week before I started the strips and I've been using it consistently this whole time. I am about half way through my strips (I have missed a couple of days) and I think it's going really well. I can see results already and I feel confident that by the time they are gone, I will be happy with how my teeth look. I think the Sensodyne has really helped because so far (knock on wood), I have had NO horrible shooting pains in my teeth that we love so much. I've been using them once a day for the most part and I think that's the best way to do it. I actually decided to do it twice today, since it says that you can do that, and I do notice increased sensitivity in my teeth tonight. Not pain, but definite hot and cold sensitivity. So I'm going to stick to just once a day. Anyway, they're easy to position, stay in place very well, come off easily (with a bit of practice) and seem to be doing a good job. Two thumbs up!
