  1052. I am simply amazed by this product. I tend to be skeptical (and cynical) about just about everything, especially products that claim they'll increase whiteness by \\"three shades.\\" (What the hell is a \\"shade\\" anyway?) Well, whatever a \\"shade\\" is, I got a zillion of them. My teeth are GLOWING after about four days of use. They even whitened my porcelain crown -- something I didn't expect, since it wasn't nearly as stained as my natural teeth and I figured it must still be the original color.<br /><br />The product is convenient, they STICK so I don't have to mess with them, and they leave my teeth feeling slick and looking awesome. I AM SO PLEASED! I just put them on before I lift weights in the morning and take 'em off before I brush and head to work. Easy breezy.<br /><br />I drink a lot of coffee and red wine (for the vitamins of course.) As a result my teeth really started to look terrible. I didn't notice it in the mirror so much but in pictures they always looked like crap. I kept thinking I would go to the dentist and have them whitened but then you have to take time off work. What a hassle. These are easy and they work. I just can't emphasize enough how happy I am.<br /><br />They do make my teeth hurt, but my teeth are naturally sensitive anyway so I brush with Colgate Sensidyne. I think it's important to put the strips on before you brush, then brush with desensitizing toothpaste immediately afterward. I haven't stopped using the strips yet but I suspect my teeth will slowly return to their typical level of sensitivity after I'm done with the box. I can easily do this once every few months if necessary. Totally worth it. Extra points to Crest if they decide to make whitening strips that already have fluoride in them so you don't have to use desensitizing toothpaste afterward.<br /><br />Another downside if you can call it that: The top strip is only wide enough to cover the smile of someone with a mouth the diameter of a broom handle. A lot of the yellow in my smile was on the front side of the rear molars which you can easily see whenever I open my gaping maw. The solution of course is to put the strip across the rear teeth on alternating days. You have to be especially careful not to get the rear side of the strips wet with saliva as you do this or they won't stick. It takes a little practice but it's worth the trouble.<br /><br />None of this came as any surprise. I did my research before buying the product.<br /><br />Anyway, definitely five stars.y smile was on the front side of the rear molars which you can easily see whenever I open my gaping maw. The solution of course is to put the strip across the rear teeth on alternating days. You have to be especially careful not to get the rear side of the strips wet with saliva as you do this or they won't stick. It takes a little practice but it's worth the trouble.<br /><br />None of this came as any surprise. I did my research before buying the product.<br /><br />Anyway, definitely five stars.
  1053. I used ii twice and I have noticed a huge difference. My teeth were already pretty white, but they look much brighter now. On that note, they do hurt like hell. If you already have sensitive teeth like I do, they will likely be pretty sore the next day. I also leave mine on for an hour for a greater effect, so a half hour might hurt a little less. That being said, it doesn't hurt enough to not use them. It's more painful than I thought it would be, but it's worse with the weather being so cold out and breathing in the cold air. I find that if I skip a day in between treatments it's a lot better. All in all, I think the product works as advertised. If you're wanting a brighter smile for cheap, and don't mind some pain, this product is worth it.
  1054. Crest white strips are really easy to use and don't interfere with my daily routine. I've used half the box, and I've noticed a distinct difference. i'd buy them again.
  1055. My father is a dentist and used to offer professional grade whitening using UV lights in his office. This is a service he offered for nearly a decade with a cost of at least several hundred dollars depending on how many applications were needed for the desired results. I was never a fan because of how sensitive those treatments made my teeth.<br />Well, he has since stopped the professional whitening services because he has become a huge believer in the Crest 3D Whitening product line. You can get similar results at a huge fraction of the price with these. You can apply these for 30-60 minutes depending on if you want a touch up or more of a major whitening effect. I use them for 60 min at a time with little to no sensitivity following the application. I give these 5 stars and my Dentist also supports this review!<br />Remember to brush and floss daily as part of your regiment for optimal results and to promote good oral hygiene!

  1061. I try to keep up on my teeth and brush twice a day, but to be honest, there are days where I'm lucky to have the time to brush once. Top that off with the fact I was a heavy smoker in the past (quit several years ago) and I still drink coffee to this day. So yes, my teeth aren't the whitest they could be. I tried the Crest 3d White Professional Effects Whitening Strips exactly as directed, and I did notice a significant difference after use. I'd say my teeth are now a couple shades whiter than they were before. They are still yellow... but more of a \\"pleasant\\" light yellow instead of a dirty yellow. Is that a compliment to the product? Sure it is. It's not a miracle product, but it'll work to help lighten things up a bit. The key here is it's up to you to maintain your oral health after using this product. If you continue mistreating your teeth, they're just going to lose the \\"luster\\" that this product will help you get, and they'll probably lose it fairly quickly as well. Overall, a decent product that, in combination with a good oral health regimen, can make a difference.
  1062. I used this for 4th time so far and I have no changes.<br />Instruction told me that I can use this once a day and I will see the result 3rd time i use it.<br />Well, I will keep using it until i use them all but I doubt it..
  1063. I've used Crest Whitening Strips on and off over the years. They definitely work, even after a few days. I don't like having them on for extended periods of time, so these 30 minute strips are the best fit for me.<br /><br />The thing I didn't like about strips from years past was that they were slippery and I had a hard time keeping them on. These are the exact opposite - they're like duct tape. The first time I tried to take them off, I was surprised at how much I had to pull. I don't know if I just got used to the strength or my teeth adjusted, but after a few days it wasn't that much of an issue.<br /><br />I don't usually have sensitive teeth but, I always get a little bit of sensitivity while I use them. Still, a little pain is totally worth it for sparkling teeth.
  1064. This whitener is very good, however it is very temporary. You have to use keep up your whitening regime even after you use this product, or else your teeth will go back to what they were before. Application and use are very easy though. Sometimes got sensitive teeth, but it went away.

I did experience very slight sensitivity after the first few days of using it, however it was by no means to the point where I needed to use toothpaste for sensitive teeth, nor did I have to give up eating and cold/hot foods.<br /><br />It's easy to use and the advance seal technology really helps keep the strips in place.<br /><br />Finally, YES, I have in fact gotten compliments on my smile.   1072. I drink a lot of tea and noticed that my teeth were starting to get pretty stained. I didn't want to spend a lot of money getting professional whitening done at the dentist so I tried the cheaper alternative and was surprised at how well it worked. I started noticing results within a week of using them. After 20 applications my teeth, especially the very front teeth that weren't stained that much to begin with, look great. I'm on to my second box and hope to get them just a tad bit whiter. I intend to use this maybe once or twice a year to maintain the whiteness.<br /><br />Concerning the advanced seal, the strips are long enough and stick well to your teeth though I did notice that the bottom strip would get lose around the ends and curl up by the end of the 30 minutes. As for teeth sensitivity, my teeth are a little sensitive while having the strips on and immediately after, but are fine afterwards. I only use the strips every other day to decrease teeth sensitivity. You get the same whitening results though it will take longer to see them when doing the strips every other day. I did make the mistake of using the strips on two consecutive days and my teeth hurt for days afterwards. After going back to the every other day schedule they were fine. I do notice that my teeth are a little more sensitive, but there is no constant tenderness or pain. Before I could take bites out of ice cream without any problem and now after using the strips doing so is painful. I think I'll try using sensodyne toothpaste to help with the sensitivity.
  1073. After all the fantastic reviews on this product, I had extremely high hopes of amazingly white teeth. I have to say, my teeth are noticeably whiter and the strips were easy and convenient to use.   1074. I get my teeth cleaned at the dentist once in a while but this was my first whitening product. I smoke, I drink coffee and tea 1-2 times a day during the work week and I received lasting whitening after using these strips a handful of times. I would say that when others recommend this product over a $400 whitening at the dentist its because of the relative length of whitening over price. You can use them regularly, two times a day, and regulate that off and on until you're satisfied with your degree of whitening.<br /><br />Others have reported that the downsides are:<br />1. Increased tooth sensitivity.<br />2. Temporary gum irritation.<br />3. Committing to regular usage (vs one time high powered dental visit).<br />I found that if you place the strip comfortably and use infrequently you can avoid these. Waiting the 30 minutes is a cinch. Sometimes reversing the order and using bottom strip for top teeth and top strip for bottom teeth does work. So does pushing the strip into the groves of your teeth. In order to whiten the full surface area of your teeth you will have to place the trips over a portion of your gums which will cause some temporary discomfort but it subsides within the thirty minute time period for me but your results may vary. Want whiter teeth? Buy these strips and the brightness of your smile is up to how well you follow the kit's instructions.
  1075. I am SO happy I learned of these!! My teeth have looked yellow for years...most likely from drinking cokes and hot tea. I could not believe the difference after one week...my teeth haven't looked THIS white in years and years! I highly recommend them!
  1076. They're not messing around when they market this advanced seal. These strips really stick to your teeth and can be a little difficult to remove. If you've got very short nails like I do, good luck.<br /><br />They come with 20 strips for both the top and bottom, so this is 40 strips in total. The larger strip goes on to the top and the smaller one on the bottom. You basically take out the strip, line it up to your teeth and press and hold for a few seconds until it settles. Then you wrap it around the back and press and hold for a few seconds again. Keep in mind the strips are about 3 inches long, roughly the size of your index finger, so you kind of have to learn how to align them to your teeth.<br /><br />The product page says to do it once a day, but the manual says you can do it twice a day if you want faster results. I did it once to twice a day and I got some results, but it's kind of hard to notice. Obviously you're not going to go from yellow to glow in the dark white, but you'll get a couple of shades lighter. Since you look at your teeth every day, it'll be more difficult to notice the difference so try taking a picture of your teeth with the same camera under the same lighting before and after. I didn't do this but kind of wish I had.<br /><br />Anyway, I would still recommend this to anyone that wants to whiten their teeth. As I mentioned in my review, keep in mind these are really really sticky and they don't cover your entire teeth.
  1077. Experienced some sensitivity with my teeth when using this but I just reduced the frequency to every other day. It does work and the effects do last for a while. Avoid coffee.

They look a little whiter after even those two sessions, but unless you're a beauty queen or TV star, I'm not sure that it's worth the pain if your teeth become sensitive.

  1163. These are my go-to white strips. They work great and don't make my sensitive teeth hurt too badly.   1164. I cant believe i was discouraged to buy this product after reading these reviews. In the end I'm so glad I did. This product has AMAZING effects for an at-home whitener hands down.<br /><br />I think a lot of the grievances in these reviews come with inexperience in teeth care and teeth whiteners in general. For example, DO NOT use toothpaste before applying the white strips, for it effects with the whitening process.<br /><br />A few things i'd like to note:<br /><br />1) To the people saying &#34;This product doesn't whiten all of my teeth&#34; You do realize, that you cannot just put the white strip OVER the teeth? Teeth aren't bricks. You have to fold the strip into the teeth. For example, I start in the middle of the whitestip, put my finger on it, and smooth it out over my teeth towards the ends MAKING SURE it forms to my teeth. Besides, Even if it does not touch every part of your teeth, the gooey whitening agent, once reacted, will cover all of those spots and form to your teeth. (especially if the strip is able to cover the backside of your teeth too, if not it's sstill fine.)<br /><br />2) To the people saying &#34;It hurts my gums/teeth/&#34; Well, with the gum thing, do not under ANY circumstance put this on your gums!! You're supposed to get it close, but not actually have the strip cover the gums! I did this one time and my gums HURT. From then on I didn't have it touch my gums and discomfort disappeared.<br /><br />3) To the people saying &#34;not good for sensitive teeth&#34; This one was a big deal breaker for me at first. My teeth are incredibly sensitive; eating ice cream hurts. I find it odd that I found no sensitivity as all with this product. Food for thought.<br /><br />Regardless, I achieved great results, my teeth are shades whiter, but not that nasty florescent white. It looks natural.<br />For anyone interested in my routine:<br /><br />1. 30 min after eating dinner I quickly run my wet toothbrush across my teeth (No toothpaste! This is important! The toothpaste can react with the whitening process)<br />2. I apply the whitestrip bottom first, starting in the center of my teeth and smoothing it out as far many teeth it reaches and fold it over the back of my teeth.<br />3. Same with the top<br />4. Press the strips in again, making sure they are activating and are on correctly (sometimes on the bottom teeth, saliva can make them move around, gotta go fast!)<br />5. Set an alarm for 30min since I am forgetful<br />6. After 30min, remove bottom, then top and brush teeth as normal.<br /><br />After the 20 day regimen, I now use Activated Charcoal to keep my teeth this shade of white. It's inexpensive and is a natural teeth cleaner/whitener. Look into it!portant! The toothpaste can react with the whitening process)<br />2. I apply the whitestrip bottom first, starting in the center of my teeth and smoothing it out as far many teeth it reaches and fold it over the back of my teeth.<br />3. Same with the top<br />4.   1247. These Crest White strips are perfect for maintenance. I usually use the intensive version of these strips, however these are really good to use on an everyday basis for only a half an hour! The stronger ones burn my guns and you're supposed to wear them for 2 hours so it was always difficult for me to find the perfect time to wear them. These Crest white strips are perfect. I wake up in the morning, brush my teeth, and pop these little strips on and do the whole shower routine and get ready for work. By the time I'm about to walk out the door, it's time to take of these strips. They also don't leave any nasty residue on my teeth.   1258. This product works well; in my opinion, all the Crest whitners work well. I drink at least two cups of coffee daily and also occasionally drink red wine. My teeth do become yellow over time, and these products keep the yellow away and my smile fresh.<br /><br />These strips stay on very well. The first time I used them, they were quite difficult to remove. The next day, I rinsed my mouth with warm water and then gently peeled. I repeated that process until they came off. After they're off, I used my toothbrush without any product to remove the reside. My teeth felt very clean after the brushing.<br /><br />My teeth are usually sensitive with all these products. I kept these strips on for 30 minutes the first time, but had sensitivity issues the next morning. The subsequent uses were for 20 minutes, and that was better. My bottom teeth are more sensitive than the top, and aren't seen as much when I smile. I use the bottom strips every other day to minimize the sensitivity, but use the top strips daily.<br /><br />Generally, I find that using the box over a years' time works best for me. So, with the 20 strips, I will use 5 strips every three months. In that way, my teeth stay relatively stain-free and the sensitivity is kept to a minimum.<br /><br />I suggest that you tailor your own program to meet your needs and sensitivity.<br /><br />Generally, I feel that this is a good product, I'm pleased with the on-going product enhancements and would recommend.

  1288. I will be the first to say that this product is not for everyone. For those who have the right type of enamel that is strong and not overly porous you should notice a dramatic whitening effect. I have given this product though to my family members and they have very mixed results. For my sister-in-law they actually highlighted the discolorations of her teeth which was really disappointing. She drinks a ton of coffee and has soft enamel. So while this whitened some parts of her teeth it did nothing to others. She tried this product twice with the same results. My dentist literally cannot believe how reactive my teeth are to this product. I actually have professional whitening trays and this product works better for my teeth than doing professional whitening. I do have severe sensitivity and gum irritation when using the professional whitening gel and trays. So that is why I consulted with my dentist as to what he recommended for me. Do not get me wrong, the professional trays got my teeth white, but I did not want the side effects that came with it. With that said, I strongly recommend consulting your dentist before trying this product especially if you have a good dentist patient relationship. I believe they can definitely tell you if over the counter treatments will be effective based upon your teeth and dentition. If this product is recommended for you then definitely try this whitening kit. Since my teeth are already white, I use this kit as a touch up twice a year. I always get a good expiration date with a lot of longevity when I buy this product on Amazon. You definitely want to always make sure you have a fresh product whether you buy this on Amazon or locally. So check the expiration when you receive or before buying. I personally could not beat the Amazon pricing locally for this product. I also love that Amazon offered me a coupon when I put it in my car so I saved even more than I first expected. This arrived quickly to my condo. These strips stay securely on your teeth until you pull them off. I always use a paper towel or tissue when I pull these off. If not the tips of my fingers will get white from the whitening gel. This usually goes away after a day or so. But if you use a paper towel or tissue you should not experience this. I do not have pain in my teeth or gums after using these. I do experience dry mouth and tongue though the day after. So I really try to stay well hydrated when using these. Sometimes I also get chapped lips but that side effect goes away 48 hours after I am done using these. I also like that this product does not have any after taste or chemical taste when there are in your mouth. This product definitely works better if you do not brush your teeth before using. Of course make sure your teeth are clean so swish some water before placing these on your teeth, but this product works better for me personally if I do not use them immediately after brushing. For those who say they experience side effects or do not get a level of whitening they expect then I recommend making sure you are following the directions to the letter and if you are then contact Crest for a refund. Just make sure you have proof of purchase. Good luck if you decide to try these.   1330. I did not notice a difference after three days (what the packages advertises) but after five days I did notice brighter, not whiter teeth. On day 11, I stopped using Crest 3d and after two more days the pain went away.<br />The product works, but with painful side effects.<br /><br />UPDATE<br /><br />Since my last review I finished using Crest 3d white strips every other day or every three days. The result was amazing!I recently went to my dentist and he asked me who did my whitening treatment because they did a really good job. He actually thought that my teeth were whitened professionally! Since then I have had many people comment on how white my teeth are. By skipping days between strips I avoided the tooth sensitivity and gum pain and achieved unbelievable results. I do recommend this product and change my review to 4 stars. But be careful.

  1335. Hello everyone,<br />I bought this product (my first box). I was following the directions...with no results at all.<br />Got frustrated, couldn't believe it, ended up buying my second box after reading a lot of great reviews. Started using it different way on my stubborn teeth.<br />So let me share how it works for me.... I use it one time a day for one hour. Seal one tooth at a time with my finger nail very carefully not to damage the strip. After one hour I take it off and brush my teeth with kids toothpaste. I have 6 strips to go, my teeth are not sensitive at all (the brushing after with kids toothpaste is very important to get all the residue off and make it stop working). My teeth are finally totally white!!<br />So I thought I would share it with you...thank you.<br />Good luck.

  1409. First off let me tell you that this product was recommended to me by a friend who’s teeth were already pretty white. It sounds like a weird distinction, but I think it matters a lot if you’re trying to figure out if your teeth are really going to get whiter or not. The product itself was one of the easy to use, simply open the strips and put them around your teeth. There was some slight sensitivity in using it, but the convenience factor made me pretty happy with for the first few days.<br /><br />But I noticed after a few times using the whitestrips that there were parts of my teeth that the strip did not cover, when I smiled you could still see yellow in the crevices of your teeth. Its funny other reviews mentioned the same thing, but I didn’t listen because the product was so popular. I think this is the main difference from using a strip-type whitening product, and actually going to the dentist to have it done: the whitestrips do not form to your teeth 100%, so they can not whiten 100% of the teeth’s surface!<br /><br />I looked into getting my own dentist to whiten my teeth, but it ended up that it was going to cost a couple hundred bucks, so I researched a little more on it. Turns out there’s a few different products out there that you can buy for home use, that have the same strength as the ones dentists use and also use molded-trays that cover the parts of your teeth that strips can not.<br /><br />[[ASIN:B00HJDIAGC This teeth whitening kit]] worked a lot better. The good thing about this product is it has heat-molded trays that literally wrap around your teeth 100%, and if you use a q-tip to apply the solution to your teeth, there is no sensitivity when using this product.<br /><br />I liked this because that gel can sting your gums if you get it on them, so the heat-molded trays and qtip technique are really the most important part of buying a whitening kit - and this is something you can't control with whitest rips. I prefer this type of system way more than the strips, because it really does whiten your teeth more than the crest strips would ever do. The bad thing about trays is it takes a few minutes in the beginning to get the right fit around your teeth, but it’s well worth that setup time for perfect fitting mouth pieces, and is something crest can’t offer.<br /><br />Overall I’d give Crest White Strips a 3 out of 5. It’s convenient enough to use daily, but it really did not cover my teeth as well as products with heat trays.han the strips, because it really does whiten your teeth more than the crest strips would ever do. The bad thing about trays is it takes a few minutes in the beginning to get the right fit around your teeth, but it’s well worth that setup time for perfect fitting mouth pieces, and is something crest can’t offer.<br /><br />Overall I’d give Crest White Strips a 3 out of 5. It’s convenient enough to use daily, but it really did not cover my teeth as well as products with heat trays.

It's not a matter of stains or wear, but just the natural color of some teeth is not brilliant white. He said those people would benefit for from bleaching as opposed to the peroxide treatments, as that's the only way the teeth would get 'white,' but bleaching can cause other issues. I had that in mind when going into this recent use, but figured I'd see if the results would be the same with the stronger, improved product.<br /><br />After the eleven treatments over 11 days, I am seeing SOME change. More of just a homogenization of the color as opposed to a super-whitening (which tells me the product is helping with some stains). There is some lightening as well, but it's not an 'expected' result based on the product claims (not even sure if qualifies as a one-shade whitening). I am starting to get some sensitivity now, but plan to continue the treatments until the end. While they are on I keep some tissue in my mouth so I don't shallow my the chemical saliva. You look funny, but it is worth it so you don't have that stuff down your throat.<br /><br />I have no problem getting them off. I just use my nail to push up from the gum area to get them off.<br /><br />Don't drink any too cold/hot water after you take them off. It was help keep the sensitivity at a manageable level. I also alternative and<br />then combine two bottom ones (with a little overlap in the middle) to cover my teeth.<br /><br />Disclaimer: You really don't see much difference in 3 days as the ad. says (the is misleading for sure), you really have to get through at least 10 days to notice.
  1439. I just finished my first box of this product and thought I'd share my results. To begin with, I'm a former smoker and have had a yellow tint to my teeth for years. I have used other whitening strips in the past, including those manufactured by Crest, but the 3D Professional Effects definitely take the cake!<br /><br />*COST: At a SRP of $54.99 these white strips are nearly $20 more than their predecessor. I purchased these on sale and with a coupon otherwise I more than likely would have opted for something else. The price on Amazon is a steal compared to stores!<br /><br />*USE: A major improvement is the Advanced Seal technology. When they say that these strips don't move they mean it. They bonded to my teeth instantly but were easily removed after 30 minutes. The seal also prevents the whitening agents from seeping into your mouth during use, hallelujah! 30 minutes once a day compared to the previous twice a day was a welcomed change as well.<br /><br />*SENSITIVITY: I don't have sensitive teeth to begin with and the only time that I've experienced it in the past has been with whitening strips. Aside from a slight discomfort with my bottom teeth the morning after first use, I didn't experience any with 3D.<br /><br />*RESULTS: Overall, I'm thrilled with the outcome. I wouldn't go so far to say that the results are comparable to professional whitening but they definitely whitened better than any other products I've used in the past. On a scale of 1-10, I'd rate my results as a 7.<br /><br />I'll say it time and time again: BUY THESE! And buy them on Amazon to save nearly $25, too! Crest hit it out of the ballpark with this product.
  1440. I bought this product to whiten my teeth before a special event. Although I was skeptical, based on previous Crest Whitestrips that I bought and used a few years ago, these new ones seemed to work quicker. Within about a week, I could see results. They are easy to use and didn't bother me when I had them in my mouth, although a friend of mine said she couldn't tolerate it and gave up. I'm guessing some people may be more sensitive than others. I put them in and could talk with them on my teeth. Eat a snack or take a drink before using them, though, because it takes 30 minutes and there is no eating or drinking with them in place. They come with coupons in the box, and I'm planning on buying more to use occasionally to keep my teeth as white as possible.

  1529. It seems like the biggest complaint with these strips is sensitivity, so I'm going to use the first part of this review to give some recommendations on alleviating the sensitivity. You can markedly decrease the sensitivity by using Sensodyne (or a similar product) as your regular toothpaste while using the strips. This is my third time (in about 7+ years) using crest whitestrips and I am always thrilled with the results. I have experienced more sensitivity with this kind than others previously, but I found that using maximum strength sensodyne eliminates the sensitivity enough that I don't have to take day(s) off in order for the sensitivity to go away. I've also heard that using a fluoride rinse can help, but I haven't tried it. I was really surprised that this product had anything less than 5 star reviews, and hopefully this helps some users because the results are really phenomenal. Also, do not use these after brushing, as the instructions say. If you have sensitivity, wait to resume using them until it goes away or you will just make it worse. But I promise these are worth sticking with because they really do deliver!<br /><br />I drink a LOT of coffee, tea, soda, and wine and I don't want anything less than a bright white, celebrity-esque blinding smile. These strips do the trick. I used my first set about 7 years ago and while chatting with a girl I had never met before, with my Starbucks in hand, she remarked that my teeth were really white and asked how I managed to keep them that way even as a coffee drinker. I divulged that the Crest Whitestrips were responsible for my pearly whites. I was thrilled that my teeth were so white that a complete stranger wanted to know my secret, and I hadn't even finished the box yet! Since then, every couple of years I will get the urge to touch up my results so they stay really white despite my consumption of staining beverages. I'm almost half way through the box and I'm thrilled that my teeth are on their way to being bright white again! I did notice that I had a hard time gauging my own results, I guess partially because lighting affects it and I see myself every day. Pictures can be misleading, but I find it really hard to believe that you could use this entire box and not notice significant whitening. I noticed the biggest difference when standing in front of a window (or outside) so I would recommend using that to gauge your level of whitening.being bright white again! Her braces left no marks or outlines. Her goal was to gradually brighten her teeth a few shades in a way that didn't scream, &#34;Look! I'm whitening my teeth!&#34;<br /><br />She wore them for 30 minutes five evenings in a row, brushing with Crest toothpaste after removing the strips. After noticing some slight sensitivity to hot/cold, she took two days off and switched to sensitive toothpaste per customer recommendations in the product reviews. This was incredibly helpful. She maintained a five days on, two days off routine for one month and did not<br />experience any further sensitivity.<br /><br />We are both very pleased with the results. The 3D Whitestrips worked gradually so the improvement appeared very natural.<br /><br />The strips caused her to have really bad breath so she was diligent about keeping breath mints or gum handy.<br /><br />If the strips were touching any part of her gums, it would begin to burn.   1554. I am a coffee drinker, and not even J-Lo could entice me to give up my morning cups of \\"joe.\\" This has impacted what should be \\"pearly whites,\\" leaving a perpetual slightly darker look. I just had my teeth professionally cleaned again, and the technician told me to get in gear and get these teeth WHITE. These Whitestrips come highly recommended, so I decided to give it a shot, but expecting totally nothing. I started three days ago, keeping in mind how much PAIN I had when trying the tray/whitener purchased from the dentist some years ago. I mean, that HURT! That pain also caused me to give up the treatment after only one day. I applied the initial set of Whitestrips and awaited the top of my head to pop off ... nothing. There was absolutely no pain, no tingles, and ... unfortunately ... no J-Lo. I figured the things weren't working. I kept them on for the half-hour with no problems. I decided, with no pain, to try twice each day, and have been doing just that for these three days. All I can (truthfully) say is: WOW! THESE THINGS WORK! My teeth are positively gleaming! I know everyone is different and, keeping in mind that severe pain I had from the tray/whitener previously, I can sympathize with some folks not being able to handle these on a daily schedule. I echo the suggestion that perhaps those people can apply these every-other-day. I also feel that keeping them off your gums will probably go a long way in tolerating the strips. In the end, I am a super satisfied customer and absolutely will go back to these strips whenever the need arises.
  1555. Let me start by saying these work, and I will buy these strips again the very next time I see them on sale (I'm cheap, and Amazon has great sales on these). I went on travel for work for 4 weeks, leaving my fiance at home. I used these over the course of the 4 weeks I was away, and when I got back and my fiance met me at the airport, she said my teeth looked whiter and asked if I'd been using anything! I was wondering if she'd notice, and she said she noticed as soon as I first smiled, but didn't want to greet me with \\"Hi, your teeth look white!\\" If there's any proof that these work, I'd say this is it. :D<br />These are easy to apply, stick extremely well and are comfortable to wear for the 30 minutes per application Crest recommends, and might only be a little difficult to talk during that time. I actually wore them longer during times I didn't want to stop what I was doing to take them off. I had previously used the ones for sensitive teeth, and I'll never use them again. The \\"sensitive teeth\\" ones are thin, don't stick very well, and are difficult to wear without moving them out of position with my tongue (probably why they recommend only 3 minutes per application). My teeth don't feel sensitive after using these \\"professional effects\\" strips at all.<br /><br />This is a great product, and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking to whiten their teeth at home.

  1572. My teeth were visually whiter after using the very first strip . I have now used 15 of the twenty strips and I am very pleased. I have suffered none of the sensitivity problems that others have reported. I have followed the advice not to brush my teeth before I apply the strips. Therefore, I apply the strips when I get up in the morning and set a timer for thirty minutes. When it goes off I remove the strips, rinse my mouth with water, eat breakfast, then brush my teeth. It works for me. When I apply the strips I put them loosely in position. Then, starting in the middle, I use my fingernail to press the strip into the joint between two teeth. Then I hold that spot in place while I use a fingernail from my other hand to press the strip into the next joint and so on down the line. The excess width I fold in toward the back of my teeth but I do not press it against my teeth since, when it is time to remove it, I reach in and flip it back up with my finger and use it to pull the strip off. The strips are so wide that I believe that it would be possible to cut each one into two pieces lengthways and use them but I have not tried this.

  1600. I logged onto the computer today JUST to come to Amazon to submit this review. I began using daily and experienced sensitivity on the backside of my teeth so I switched to every other day. These strips won't move even if you want them to; they really stick to the teeth with no chance of letting saliva in or of the gel leaking out into your mouth & tongue - a real plus in my book. The strips cover the gums but do not irritate them at all. Well worth the cost and I am so glad I found something I know will work. I will buy this again and again and again.

I get lots of compliments on my &#34;beautiful smile&#34; and still enjoy cigarettes, and coffee every day, and dark sodas on occasion. They don't hurt your enamel, and even my dentist says &#34;you have such healthy beautiful while teeth!&#34; I tried off brand ones, and found they were a waste of money and time. They don't stick well, hurt my gums, or whiten the fronts of my teeth, but don't get in between my crooked teeth. Amazon is definitely the place to buy them. Cheaper than anywhere, and talk about a bargain of a confidence booster compared to the almost $600 I was quoted for whitening trays from the dentist that insurance won't cover. I even said, &#34;no thanks. I'll stick with my crest whitestrips.&#34; And the dentist couldn't even argue with it.

I just bought a WHEY protein powder and on there are people who are lactose-intolerant giving 1-star reviews because of the lactose-intolerant symptoms they get when they use the product! I'm tired of negative reviews that do not fairly judge the product and push naive people away from products that can significantly help most other people.<br /><br />Reviewers claim they don't work. That's BS. The only way these don't work is if you already have brilliant white teeth or you are putting them in wrong. As for the people claiming these hurt them so badly they need to &#34;take pain medication to sleep&#34; - they are degrading a product based on their own dental issue that has nothing to do with the product. The only whitening ingredient is hydrogen-peroxide. It's used to lift stains. So if that's hurting you - you might have an infection. I would bet that if every reviewer who claims these strips are hurting them swished some hydrogen peroxide in their mouths - they would be in pain because they have an infection.<br /><br />BOTTOM LINE: These work for me under the criteria that should be used to review this product. Keep in mind that sometimes it is not the product - it's you.

  1704. Being someone with sensitive teeth, I was a bit leery of using these whitening strips, especially since I've never used a teeth whitening product before, and wasn't quite sure what to expect outside of all of the negatives that I've heard and read online.<br /><br />Thankfully, Crest's 3D White Whitestrips are really quite gentle, and, happily, they actually work!<br /><br />The odd foaming sensation took a bit of getting used to, but I appreciated that the white strips stayed in place once applied to my teeth. Simply open up the small foil pouch, remove one strip at a time, and apply them to the upper and lower teeth, pressing them in place. Crest actually advises against brushing your teeth prior to application, which I was initially surprised about. I'm guessing that these adhere better to teeth that aren't freshly brushed, and that recent brushing may actually abrade your teeth more than you might want just prior to a whitening treatment.<br /><br />Since the bleaching agent doesn't taste that great, I found myself making a restroom trip to get rid of the extra moisture that these produce, about once every ten minutes or so. But the simple fact that they're so portable would make it quite easy for one to take them to work with them, and whiten there (being a school teacher, I think my little ones might find it a bit odd that I seemed to be foaming at the mouth, so not so much in my case! ; D ).<br /><br />Honestly, I have no doubt that these strips are just as effective as a whitening session with my dentist would be, especially since my dental hygienist pretty much said that these would do just as good a job for 10% (at full retail price) of what I'd pay my dentist, when I asked her about them. That, alone, convinces me that I'll be using these again in the future, once my now significantly brighter smile starts to dim again!<br /><br />Good job, Crest! I'll be back for more!

  1713. I had fillings done on both front teeth after an accident 14 years ago. The fillings looked much whiter than my teeth and there was a dark yellow line on the seam. One of the teeth has started to discolour because it needed a root canal.<br /><br />I was given these whitestrips by a friend who knew I was considering having my teeth professionally whitened. Although I don't have sensitive teeth, I followed the advice of a dentist to start using sensodyne (or some other sensitive toothpaste) a few weeks before the whitening. He also recommended not using a whitening toothpaste during the process. I don't like the coating the sensodyne toothpaste leaves in my mouth but it was so effective I didn't have any sensitivity while using the whitestrips.<br /><br />I found Crest whitestrips easy to use. My mom who was visiting when I started using them and she noticed a small difference after 2 days. I saw a difference after 4 days. I followed the process to the letter and applied the strips every night for 30min for 15 days. The last five strips I have been applying every other day. There is a tingling sensation on the gums but no pain. I also had a small white spot appear on one of my teeth but as it says on the web, it disappears after a couple of hours. It is the drying out of the enamel and that's why it is important not to use whitening toothpaste while using crest whitestrips.<br /><br />After 10 days, my friends noticed (unsollicited) that I had whiter teeth and after 15 days it is now hard to see the the fillings on the front teeth. The rootcanal tooth is still a minuscule bit darker but the other teeth are all white.<br /><br />I would say they are as white as they were 12 years ago, and I think that is the natural colour of my teeth. I was not looking for a Hollywood smile, I wanted a bright smile and healthy looking teeth. Mission accomplished!

I followed the instructions precisely so there was never any sensitivity and my gums never turned white. However the peroxide does leave a nasty aftertaste in your mouth whenever your tongue brushes against your teeth. I'm assuming it will go away after a few days.<br /><br />All in all I don't think I will buy another box unless I can get it at the $30 price point I've seen on Amazon.   1718. I was told that these strips work more effectively on teeth with a yellowish stain than those with more of a grayish color. And of course, not everyone will get the same results.<br /><br />I've never had sensitive teeth, so unlike a lot of the reviewers here, that hasn't been a problem for me. I've been applying the upper and lower strips twice a day for 30-40 minutes for three days so far. The difference I see already is pretty exciting. My only comments --mainly for mature folks whose teeth have naturally lengthened with age-- is that the strips are a little bit narrow for covering the full height of your teeth. Also (for everyone) if your teeth aren't perfectly straight, you'll want to take care to place the strips so they make the fullest possible contact with the entire surface of each tooth --which can be tricky.<br /><br />Generally, however, so far I couldn't be more impressed with this product!

  1726. I used this product a few years ago, but discontinued it after I received a sudden SHOCK of pain. It was so bad to the point where I'd gasp and have to run to the bathroom to rip them off my teeth and use water to rinse it out. Afterward my teeth became extra sensitive to cold, sweets, etc. and would remain extra sensitive for weeks. Mind you, I take very good care of my teeth (brush them twice a day, floss every day, use Listerine, etc.) so it wasn't anything I was doing to make them so sensitive. It was the whitening strips.<br /><br />So I was in the Dollar Tree the other day and saw a product called \\"5 minute tooth whitening\\" for just $1. I figured, what the hey I'll give that a try just to see. I was not expecting it to work, but amazingly it did! And I received NO PAIN while using it. It's been 4 days and still NO PAIN from this 5 minute tooth whitening product, while at the same time getting whiter teeth. I am very surprised that an item that cost me $1 works better than something that costs $40.<br /><br />If anyone is interested, they have the product I use right here on Amazon: Just type into Amazon's search bar - \\"5 MINUTE NATURAL WHITE TOOTH WHITENING SYSTEM\\" ... Trust me, it works.
  1727. It did brighten them up ​a bit, however, afterward, I brushed my teeth, and all of a sudden I feel this immense pain from within my tooth and had to stop brushing them. Afterward there was mild pain that was bothersome, but not unbearable. It's best if you don't use this particular product if you have sensitive teeth.<br />​For the service though, it was spot on! Shipping was fast and everything came as it should.
  1728. Strips arrived promptly as promised. The strips are very dry and stick like glue to your teeth. My teeth are already pretty white but after only two days use I can see a difference. I would recommend using toothpaste for sensitive teeth a few weeks before treatment as it helps cut down on sensitivity which can be painful for some people causing them to stop before the 21 days are up.
  1729. I was hesitant about these at first, because after reading reviews, I wasn't sure how much mileage I would get out of these.<br />I've used about half of the treatments now, and I am very pleased with the results.<br /><br />As per the recommendation of another reviewer, I used two treatments per day for the first few days. While I did see great results more quickly, after three days my teeth became very sensitive to the strips. Using the strips is no problem, but if I use them in the morning, by the evening my teeth are very sensitive and hurt constantly. The pain isn't too bad, but it is fairly uncomfortable.<br />After doubling on treatments for the first few days, I switched to one treatment per day, and the results are still noticeable.<br /><br />I definitely recommend these, but if you want to save yourself some toothache, try using just one treatment per day.<br />Additionally, I would suggest using Crest Sensitivity toothpaste. Regular brushing with this seems to take the edge off of any toothache that may result from using the strips.
  1730. i already have fairly white teeth and that being said not much change with strips. usually with other brands i seem to get a brighter whiter smile

  1743. Extremely underwhelmed by 3D Whitestrips Professional Effects. I only have slight yellow staining, and after using 17 of the 20 strips included, I can categorically say that this product will not turn mildly stained teeth white. It will make your teeth less yellow, but even then - from my perspective - the difference in shade was scarcely evident after almost a full course. What makes the whole thing even more disappointing is that the results you get stand in stark contrast to the ridiculous claims on the front of the box. Whitens as well as $500 treatments? Not a chance.<br /><br />As for the \\"Advanced Seal\\" design of the strips: I'm not sure what Crest's definition of \\"Advanced\\" is, but we disagree. These things were very, very irritating. Firstly, the moment the strips come into contact with your teeth, they cannot be moved unless you yank them off. This means that if you apply them incorrectly, you can't slide them along and readjust like you can with other Crest whitestrips. That's problematic if the strip isn't touching some of your teeth. Secondly, for whatever reason, I personally had an unusual amount of saliva and air build up between my teeth and the strips. I haven't experienced that with any other type of whitening strip, and while I don't know whether or not it reduced their efficacy, it meant that I was constantly fiddling around trying to flatten out air bubbles. Just awkward.<br /><br />Simply put, do not buy this product. Instead, pay a little bit extra for Crest Supreme Professional Whitening. I'm half way through a batch of these right now and the results are significantly more noticeable. Why is that? Well, for one thing, they contain 14% hydrogen peroxide bleaching gel (4% more than 3D Whitestrips Professional Effects). Secondly, you will be applying the upper and lower strips twice a day, as opposed to once a day. This will always result in BETTER, FASTER results. Thirdly, the design of the strips is significantly better. They hold tight to your teeth, but barely any air bubbles form, and you can readjust them if necessary. Fourthly, you get 84 strips in total, as opposed to the measly 40 strips you get in Professional Effects.<br /><br />In summary, as someone who has used both products, I can guarantee more impressive results with Crest Supreme Professional Whitening. Always opt for them instead.our teeth, but barely any air bubbles form, and you can readjust them if necessary. Fourthly, you get 84 strips in total, as opposed to the measly 40 strips you get in Professional Effects.<br /><br />In summary, as someone who has used both products, I can guarantee more impressive results with Crest Supreme Professional Whitening. Always opt for them instead.

After a few days of use, most parts of the teeth applied to had gotten noticeably whiter. 10 days in the entirety of the teeth applied to had gotten whiter. By the end of the regimen my smile had gotten extremely white and I was very pleased.<br /><br />The sensitivity every body speaks of... very unpleasant. Yes. I notice nothing while treatment is being applied. I notice nothing for several hours, not affected by heat, or cold, or volatile foods of any kind. But sooner or later during the day, the tips of my front teeth get VERY sensitive and ache quite bad. Goes away after an hour or two and is completely fine in the morning when I wake up. Not a good thing, but entirely manageable in my experience.<br /><br />Applying the strips is an adventure to line them up inside the mouth with the lip in the way. For a minute after applied it takes some tinkering to get everything sealed and 10 to 20 minutes in the edges can come a little loose but all together a hassle free experience. Very good results, a few very minor issues can be had, but for the results the price and these issues aren't all together that bad.<br /><br />I highly recommend it.
  1832. Excellent product, does exactly what it says it will. Dramatic results within a week. Easy to use, stays in place & very convenient.
  1833. Very much it was pleasant to me. The bleaching system came to time. I and further wanted to work with you.
  1834. This order was received quickly. The price was great, best I found anywhere. It was a gift for my daughter and she was thrilled with the result.
  1835. I wanted whiter results... it did work. they are super comfortable. I can live my life with them on. but the results are maybe like 2 shades of a difference. It worked. but I wish it worked better. And my teeth weren't that yellow to begin with
  1836. Like the rating of 3 stars say's its OK, but don't think this is like going to a Dentist. I hate paying the high prices that Dentists charge so tried these.   1837. I was skeptical, but these do work.<br /><br />I'm 15 days into the 20 days of strips. I use them as directed (30 minutes a day, once a day). I took a 4-day break after a week because I was on vacation.<br /><br />Results: Teeth are far whiter and I still have nearly a week to go. I had very minimal sensitivity, but no pain. The sensitivity wears away by the end of the day, and does not linger. My teeth had yellowed due to excessive coffee drinking, and this is bringing them back to how white they were about 10 years ago.

My teeth are already a shade whiter (note, this is the FIRST day of use). I'm a soldier so I will continue to use the strips until either I die from the pain or I finish the box. I actually had to remove them from the underside of my teeth first because these REALLY stick on. Of course I still notice some yellowing near my gum line, but I'm happy with the results and will probably give these another go in 6 months. Take my advice - take a couple steps back from the mirror when you're trying to tell if your teeth are any whiter, or better yet, compare the teeth the strips touched to those teeth further back that the strips didn't reach - huge difference.

  1905. Wow- Crest has REALLY stepped up their game with their Whitestrips adhesive. I usually use the 5 Minute Touch Up strips, but twice a year I do a re-whitening and this time around I was shocked at how STICKY the 3D strips are. They are like duct-tape for your teeth- once you adhere them, they are STUCK. And they won't shift or move after you adhere them (unlike the 5 Minute strips, which pretty much sit in the *vicinity* of your teeth while they are on and literally fall out of your mouth if you aren't still.) This is good because it's easy to keep them on for 30 minutes without having to be careful about not sucking the strips off your teeth, but it's kind of a pain because you can't adjust the strip once it's on your teeth. So apply carefully.<br /><br />As far as whitening, I have to be honest- they didn't get my teeth as bright at the last time I did the Professional Effects two hour strips, but clearly the two are different products.<br /><br />As far as tooth sensitivity- I gotta be honest, my teeth hurt a bit after my first use of these. The night after I used these for the first time, I was starting to worry I might need a root canal in one of my teeth until I remembered I was using the Whitestrips (total relief!) After that first application, there wasn't much of an issue with sensitivity- a tiny bit as far as hot/cold, but nothing excruciating. However, I have gotten tiny cavities drilled without novocaine before (the shots hurt more than the drilling for me!) so your mileage may vary on the pain factor. Just be aware you might feel some sensitivity after you use them but it does let up.<br /><br />All in all, good product.

  1957. pro:<br />it works very well.<br />it is very easy to apply<br /><br />cons:<br />it hearts very bad if your teeth a little bit broken from any side.
  1958. overall love the whitestrip technology. Definitely whitens your teeth, and if you are like me and dont have any major hard stains, then really doing only 3-4 day rounds of this product will work. I am on the fence of the new no slip technology. I find the product almost too hard to remove. I really have to give it a yank to get it off. In general I prefer the old ones better for me. I just found them more easy to remove, and I could be more discreet about wearing and removing them. Plus, using this product too many days in a row hurts my teeth. I prefer every other day or for shorter periods of time. In general great product that really improves the look of your teeth.
  1959. Firstly, this product does an incredible job! Your teeth are definitely noticeable whiter I would say even after the first few strips, and it just keeps getting better! However, and not everyone may experience this, I definitely noticed an increase in sensitivity after using these. The sensitivity would actually last all day, and after 3 days of using the strips, I had to use them every other day instead of every day. Still, it was worth it for the price and time.
  1960. I've done two rounds of this stuff, and it really works. People have been complimenting on my white teeth. It's been about 5 months since I've last used it, results are still there!
  1961. If you are looking to whiten your teeth without going to the dentist and spending a lot of money this is what you need. A bit pricey but it's worth every dollar for the results you get.
  1962. Ive used cheaper white strips from crest in the past without any problems. But these 3D strips caused my teeth to be very sensitive for 2 days after each use. So I can only use the strips about 1 time a week. I will say that after 8 treatments my teeth are noticeably whiter. I will probably continue using them at a lower frequency.
  1963. I don't drink much coffee or tea and I don't smoke, so my teeth weren't very stained to begin with. But they were a bit dingy, and yellowish around the gumline.<br /><br />These whitestrips worked really well... better than I expected considering that I was starting from mostly-white teeth. The results are clearly noticeable, and I imagine they would be even more dramatic for those starting with darker-stained teeth.<br /><br />I'm not sure what some other reviewers found so difficult about using them. You just peel the sticky strip off the plastic backing, press the strip onto your unbrushed teeth (toothpaste can prevent the gel from penetrating, I guess) wait a half hour, then pull them off and throw them away. Maybe if you don't have the patience or dexterity to peel the strip off carefully and apply it properly, you won't be satisfied with them.<br /><br />One of the uploaded picture captions says they don't work between teeth. I was a bit concerned about having that problem as well since my teeth are not perfectly straight. So I made a point to press them onto my teeth one at a time starting in the front and working toward the back, rather than across all of my teeth at once. This way I could press the strip with my fingernail onto each tooth following its contours from one side to the other. That got the gel onto all of the visible areas, and all of the teeth were whitened (including in between teeth and around the gumline). I could see how your results between teeth would be worse if you don't take the time to press the strips against each tooth and squeeze the gel between them.<br /><br />Besides the fact that the gel tastes kind of gross, and they do leave some little white blotches that take a few days to fade away, I have no complaints about these strips. My teeth ended up looking naturally white in just 3 weeks and I didn't experience any sensitivity from it. I would highly recommend them, especially for the price and convenience. I'll definitely be using them again the next time I want to whiten.g them again the next time I want to whiten.
  1964. I noticed a difference in the color of my teeth in 3days, but the sensitivity was pretty bad. I do the strips once a week, the sensitivity lasts 2 days max. I just dont like the feeling. Other than that they work great!
  1965. After reading he reviews I thought I try the whitestrips for myself. here are my results:<br /><br />Pros:<br />1) Did not burn my gums/teeth<br />2) fit really nicely<br /><br />cons:<br />1) The product did not whiten my teeth. (I compared the teeth which I used the whitestrips on to my teeth that the strips could not cover). I drink almost no coffee and keep my teeth clean. Overall my teeth are not too yellow they are average from normal wear.<br />2) The strips only covered the first six teeth on my bottom teeth. I felt that was cheap that the strips were small and did not cover my full bottom smile. How much more expensive could it be to add a few centimeters?<br />3) My rebate was rejected for the offer being &#34;expired&#34; even tho clearly it says until 2014 on the box.<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />the product did not work for me plus I feel that Crest cheated me on the rebate so I'll never be buying from Crest again.<br />also my money back mail warranty offer just got plain out ignored.

  1970. I have had a long obsession with white teeth but am a little worried with some of the options available. Being these Whitestrips claim to be Enamel Safe I thought I would give them a try. They are as advertised as you will start to see results after a couple days and very noticeable after you go through the twenty strips included without any pain. They are also very easy to apply and take off though the package says no sticky mess is a bit misleading as it is a little sticky. The biggest drawback is the taste: image having the envelope glue taste in your mouth but ten times stronger for a half an hour. It took me about a week before the taste even became tolerable. But the pain-free results are worth a little bad taste in my mouth.
  1971. As someone who drinks a lot of coffee and does a lot of public speaking/video work, it's important to have great looking teeth. These strips work extremely well. Very impressed.<br /><br />You basically put what's like scotch tape 2 small strips, one on upper and one on lower, on your teeth and wait 30 minutes, then remove, daily for a few weeks. I do that while watching a tv show at night. There's no taste or hassle, they've very easy to use and effective. Finally - a product that whitens without costly hassle dental tray treatment. I'll be a repeat customer of using these for years. Thanks Crest for getting it right. A++<br /><br />-ken

  1975. However, if you have sensitive teeth, proceed with caution. But if you can use them every 2 days in conjunction with the 3D white toothpaste (on days when you don't use the strips), you can get your results without too much pain. I found that the toothpaste alone also works well if you brush twice a day, everyday. You won't get quite the same results as the strips, but I think vast improvement will be seen if you stick with it regularly.

  1990. I was really looking forward to finally having a whiter smile. I was realistic about my expectations and my teeth aren't in terrible condition, just not as white as I'd prefer them to be. I had heard great things about the Crest 3d White Professional Effects Whitening Strips and saw that they had fantastic reviews here. I ordered them and after going through the 20-day process, I do not see any difference. I took before and after photos in the same lighting and compared the two. My teeth were no white nor brighter, but I did have one outcome for this product: incredibly sore and sensitive teeth. If you have experienced sensitivity before, even to a slight extent (as I have), I do not recommend this product. The Advance Seal on the strips actually does a great job, too great as they can be difficult to take off, but the true pain comes from the hours and days after wearing the product. I finished the 20-day session two days ago and am still reeling in pain from any cold or hot drinks as well as a strong gust of wind. The sensitivity is excruciating and the result is futile. I hate leaving one-star reviews for products because perhaps this product would work for some, however, for me, I had no improvement whatsoever, incredible amounts of pain (even after I had finished the course), and was out $40. I'm going to attempt to exercise their \\"Money back guarantee\\" because I am certainly not satisfied with this product.
  1991. I NEVER review items, but this is seriously one of the best investments one can make. This is GUARANTEED to whiten your teeth so well that you will receive compliments. Thinking about buying it again, though having my teeth too white is an issue I never thought I'd deal with!
  1992. I decided to finally buy these because there was a $5 off coupon. I was skeptical they would actually whiten my teeth but have been pleasantly surprised. They have removed some stains on my front teeth which I felt were very noticeable. However, my teeth did not get as white as I would like them. I could just have naturally more yellow-tinted teeth, I don't know. One of my complains with these is the sensitivity it cause on my gums. I made sure not to have the strip on my gums but on one part of my gums in particular, they were extremely red, sore and bled when I brushed my teeth after applying these strips (my gums never bleed when I brush my teeth so this was new). The three days I forgot to use the strips I noticed that red, sore and bleeding I had with my gums went away so I don't think it's a last side effect. I would recommend these if you want to whiten your teeth, just don't expect to have an extremely extremely white smile after using them. I may purchase another box of these in a month or two and see if I can get my teeth a few shades whiter.<br />Pros:<br />1. Easy to apply & stay in place<br />2. Whitened my teeth<br />Cons:<br />1.   1999. I wanted whiter teeth ahead of my wedding, so I asked my dentist for her recommendation. I've used crest white strips and dealt with painful sensitivity from them before, so I wasn't sure what to do.<br /><br />Because my teeth are straight, she recommended I start with Crest White Strips before spending hundreds of dollars to have her whiten my teeth (I appreciate my honest dentist...), especially since treatments in the dentists office cause the same level of pain--if not more pain she said! My dentist did give me VERY good directions though. First, she said to only pay attention to the &#34;maximum&#34; directions. So since the box says no more than 2 boxes a year, and 1x a day for 30 min, not to exceed those guidelines. But I should otherwise &#34;play it by ear&#34; based on sensitivity--the effects are the same even if the strips are spaced out more. Also, I should start whitening 8-9 months in advance of my wedding, with the 2nd round of strips 2-3 months ahead of the wedding to avoid sensitive teeth on my wedding day.<br /><br />So to avoid tooth sensitivity, I started using the strips for 3 days, 1x a day. After this my teeth felt a little sensitive, so I took 4-5 days off, and then used them 2 days in a row. Then I took another 4-5 days off, and used them again for 1-2 days. This meant the package took me about 2 months to go through, but I avoided the intense sensitivity and pain I had previously felt. My teeth were still a little sensitive for a few days after use, but not to the point I couldn't eat or drink. And... MY TEETH GOT WHITER! Like, ALOT whiter. I had coworkers complimenting me on them suddenly. I was really happy with the results.<br /><br />The strips also attach really well to teeth, which was an improvement over the ones crest had out a few years ago which barely stayed on. They can actually be a little difficult to remove, but I was always able to get them off...eventually. Based on reviews here I also made sure to push the strips into the ridges around my teeth when I put them on, which helped get all of the visible areas white.<br /><br />One tip--pay attention to the directions when they said not to use them right after brushing. I forgot once, and put them on right after I brushed my teeth. It HURT. I'm guessing my toothbrush roughed up my gums, since the white strip stung and burned them. It healed overnight, but they were white and swollen for a few hours. The strips otherwise never bothered my gums which was good.e ridges around my teeth when I put them on, which helped get all of the visible areas white.<br /><br />One tip--pay attention to the directions when they said not to use them right after brushing. I forgot once, and put them on right after I brushed my teeth. It HURT. I'm guessing my toothbrush roughed up my gums, since the white strip stung and burned them. It healed overnight, but they were white and swollen for a few hours. The strips otherwise never bothered my gums which was good.

  2101. First let me start by saying I am a smoker. I had very yellow teeth as a teenager and through my young adult life. I see my dentist as recommended. When Crest first came out with white strips years back, I was hesitant to buy them. They are expensive and you really take a risk of losing a large amount of money. I asked my dentist of 20 years for a professional whitening. My dentist, told me I would get the same results from Crest white strips as a professional whitening for the fraction of the cost. My dentist was right. After 3 days My teeth looked amazing. Every year when a new line of white strips comes out, I buy them. My teeth look like what you see in the movies and I constantly get compliments. You could never tell that I am STILL a smoker. I just purchased the 3d White Professional, and these are by far the best ones I have used. It recommends 20 days of application, but my dentist advised up to 2 hours (4 strips) per day as tolerated. There will be gum sensitivity, but it will pass. If you use 4 strips a day like I did, that's only 5 days of sensitivity. It's well worth the minor pain after the 5 days. It will look as if you spent thousands on your teeth. If you are not happy with the results, crest will refund your money 100%. But, I can guarantee you, you will not be returning these for a refund.

  2143. I'm lucky enough to have structurally sound teeth that are naturally white. However, for the majority of my teenage years and early 20s, I simply didn't take care of my teeth. I'm also lucky enough to not have any damage from those many years of neglect, but the staining has...not been pretty. Let's put it that way. I've wanted to whiten my teeth for years, but I didn't want to pay the outrageous costs for a professional treatment, which I was sure was my only hope for such deep staining.<br /><br />After consulting with my dentist, I decided to give these a try. I tried White Strips about 10 years ago without success, primarily because I couldn't keep them on my teeth. I'm happy to report that these newer strips are MUCH stickier, and once you make sure they're secure, they don't budge. In fact, the top strip is even a little tough to pull off. The bottom strip is easier, but I also have somewhat oddly-shaped lower teeth, so that might not be true for everyone.<br /><br />I've used these six times now, usually every day (though I've skipped a day or two just because I forgot), and I've already noticed a major difference. Don't get me wrong, I don't have a movie star smile by any means. They're still pretty dingy. But they look SO much better than they did, even though I've only gone through about 1/4 of the box. I'm really excited to see the final results.<br /><br />My teeth aren't sensitive at all, for the most part, and I haven't noticed any sensitivity with these either. I asked my dentist about that before use, and she said sensitivity issues most often come about when people have nerve or root exposure. As that doesn't apply to me, that might be why these don't cause sensitivity for me. Just to be on the safe side, though, I've been brushing with an enamel-protecting toothpaste that's made specifically for sensitivity issues.<br /><br />I'm not confident enough to post a progress photo, but I fully plan on uploading a before and after shot once I've finished the box. In the meantime, definitely give these a try! I'm really happy I did.the box. In the meantime, definitely give these a try! I'm really happy I did.

That being said, after my gums got accustomed to it, the strips no longer became a problem. I ended up not using all of them (because of the burning problem in the beginning). So, it's nice to know that if I have an event to go to a few applications can perk up my smile.<br /><br />Of course, this is no substitute for a proper whitening at the dentist.   2267. I had never tried any teeth whitening products before this product, and I can honestly say that I probably won't need to, as the Crest 3d strips did a very good job whitening my teeth. In my case, increased whitening was noticeable after about a week of use, and the effects lasted for some time (several months).<br /><br />I deducted one star from the review because there is some discomfort in using the strips. The strips are pretty easy to apply, and they stick on your teeth pretty well, but some may not like the synthetic smell of the gel. Also, some people will experience more sensitivity than others, and for me it wasn't too bad, although there were occasions when the sensitivity could be a little uncomfortable.<br /><br />One lesson in tooth sensitivity that I learned while using these strips: DO NOT fall asleep while wearing these things. I know it sounds stupid, but I once accidentally took a 3-hour nap while wearing the strips (instructions say to remove after ~30 minutes). Needless to say, when I awoke from my much-needed slumber my teeth felt like icicles. It was like biting down on a piece of super-cold metal, and clenching your teeth on it for a few minutes--not fun.<br /><br />Other than some sensitivity (and my little mishap), I would highly recommend these strips for someone looking to whiten up their teeth.

  2301. I was amazed how quickly these strips whitened my teeth, BUT be warned, it may make your teeth hurt. I don't have sensitive teeth, so I wasn't worried, and the first few times I had no problem. However, I woke up one morning after using these the night before and my teeth were severely uncomfortable. It happened again every so often after that. If your teeth start to hurt, I recommend using these every other night and taking them off as soon as the 30 minutes is up, not a minute over.<br /><br />TL;DR - It works great, but be prepared to be a little uncomfortable occasionally.

  2354. These can and do work, but there are several factors:<br /><br />1. They are very expensive. Roughly $35 to $40 a box, and even occasional $5-$10 coupons don't ease the cost too much. (You all should also know that these are one of the most STOLEN items, next to electronics and alcohol. Common sense tells you why..)<br /><br />2. You have to use them on going. If a few strips or even one box made everybody's teeth pearly white, the product would never have an ongoing business. You have to use them religiously, and then do &#34;maintaining.&#34; Again - see above. This requires quite an investment.<br /><br />3. The product is much more convenient than say the &#34;trays of opalescence&#34; (which also do work over time, but they are messy and awkward). That is also why you are paying more for these.<br /><br />4. Can cause sensitivity for some people, sometimes mild, sometimes extreme. This can usually go away in a few hours, but, it can be painful for that time being. You have to weigh everything.<br /><br />5. Obviously, not everybody has perfect straight teeth where the strips will attach and lay evenly. Technically, in my opinion you don't necessarily have to have perfect white teeth all the way in the back sides of your mouth (nobody sees those anyways), but for people like myself who are also nit-pickers, the strips will fit different people DIFFERENTLY. For people with very bad, crooked teeth, you may get very little out of these strips.<br /><br />6. Most importantly - very few people have perfect, PERFECT white teeth in the world, not even babies. The people you see on the cable news channels, movie stars, commercial people, soap stars, etc all have airbrushing done, or they have veneers or lumineers. You have to have some degree of realistic-ness, too :)<br /><br />I recommend trying a box - it is an investment. If it works and is comfortable for you, try another box in time if you see results. If you don see any, I would look at other options.tions.

  2368. After being referred to this product, I had high hopes. The product does appear to work for various portions of the tooth (typically the upper portion near the gums). That being said, the side effects can be horrendous. The sensitive teeth in the entire mouth after utilizing this product for more than three days outweighed the product's effectiveness. This sensitivity lasts several days after stopping the product.<br /><br />One disclosure that should be made clear on this box [or in the description, in all fairness] is that persons with cardiac issues should proceed with caution. The main ingredient in this product is known to cause/worsen cardiac arrhythmia. I wish I had done my research ahead of time. Unfortunately, my arrhythmia worsened for two days. Once I stopped the product (for two days), I converted back to normal rhythm.<br /><br />I rate this product with two stars for the mere fact that it has some effectiveness; but, the rating is low based on the poor communication to the consumer of the risks.

I was unable to tolerate the Zoom treatment because of extreme sensitivity, but these Crest strips have done a great job. I have noticed that several of my friends (we are 65+) have graying or yellowing teeth, and they just don't look nice. My teeth are a beautiful and natural white, and are a very sensible alternative to the extremely expensive veneers.
