  2445. I'm 59 years old and I had used Crest Whitestrips many years ago but experienced teeth sensitivity so quit using them. In early 2014, I tried Crest Whitestrips &#34;Gentle Routine&#34; due to sensitivity fears, but they did nothing to whiten my teeth, so I gave up on them.<br /><br />I decided to be brave and ordered Crest 3D White Luxe Professional Effects Whitestrips and after using a box, found there was a noticeable degree of whitening of my yellowed teeth. I bought another box and used most of the strips later that year and have definitely noticed an improvement that has lasted. The increased whiteness is particularly noticeable to me in photographs where I'm smiling, but my husband also commented that my teeth looked whiter. I have also used Crest 3D White Luxe &#34;Glamorous White&#34; toothpaste (label states: &#34;Removes up to 90% of surface stains in 5 days&#34;) twice a day over the past year and I think it's possibly helped maintain some of the whiteness I got from the Whitestrips.<br /><br />I had minimal teeth sensitivity using this product, and the strips adhered well. After pressing the strip into place, I then pressed onto each tooth with a finger, and held it for 3 seconds to make sure the strips were well-adhered to all tooth surfaces. In the past, the old Whitestrips made me drool like a teething baby, but that didn't happen with these strips, although, it was sometimes difficult to keep my lower teeth dry enough to apply the strips due to salivating. A blotting of my teeth and gums with a paper towel helped dry some of the saliva so I could then apply the strip.<br /><br />I can recommend using this product if-- like me and my middle-aged teeth-- you don't expect dazzling, white-as-snow, Chiclet-teeth, and keep your expectations realistic. As Crest advertises, the Whitestrips supposedly remove 14 years worth of stains, and the results have been satisfactory for me. My whiter teeth have definitely given me more confidence when smiling, and I just ordered another box.t ordered another box.

I always brushed and rinsed after each use but there was still this 'sticky' feeling, not too bothersome really. Overall, they did a decent job of whitening my teeth; as far as the results lasting for any length of time, I believe that would be completely dependent on the individual's lifestyle and habits, e.g. how often they normally brush, do they drink coffee, tea, and or wine, do they smoke, etc., etc. I am about (3) weeks out from using my last strip and I can tell that there is already a bit of staining back on my teeth but I do drink coffee and tea throughout the day-I know, shame on me! I don't think anyone will be disappointed in their results but then again, no one should expect miracles from ANY cosmetic product.

  2504. These are the best strips I have tried so far to whiten teeth. Really watch out for sensitivity if this is an issue for you. Using this every day gave me a dull throbbing ache that prevented me from eating/drinking some things comfortably.   2510. My friend had used the Crest 3D whitening strips and had amazing results. He did complain about pain, but because he went through with the process for 30 days I figured the pain would be bearable and worth the result. I was wrong.<br /><br />The first day I used I started noticing sharp pain during the 30 minute prescribed use of the whitening strips. My teeth hurt mildly the following day. I thought very strange but figured it was still bearable. The second day I left the strips for 2 hours, as suggested. I can say today has been one of the most painful days of my life. I could hardly talk, I almost cried several times. My friend and I had to leave in the middle of our Sunday service because I couldn't bear the pain. We tried several pharmacies but none had anything for the pain I was feeling.<br /><br />So what was the pain like?<br />For me the pain was not on my gums but actually on my teeth. My teeth were ultra sensitive. I could not talk, or breath, or do anything without feeling a sharp pain shoot through where the whitening strips had been used. I bought a numbing paste, which I applied to my gum and teeth. That only slightly soothed my pain, but the pain was still very present. I took 4 ibuprofen and there was still pain. I bought sensodyne toothpaste, Crest sensitive toothpaste, and other sensitive cream but to no avail. I also bought Listerine Total Care. Though the Listerine burned my mouth it slowly help me bear the pain. I found that hot and warm water were the only things that actually kept the pain at bay long enough for me to squeeze a sentence out to my friends who were trying to help me. The sharp pain lasted for 24 hours and is only now subsiding. I was able to eat soup fine, but the day has been very painful.<br /><br />Though this product CLAIMS to be Enamel safe, the pharmacist told me that the whitening strips eroded my enamel hence the sharp pain I have been feeling the whole day. The pain is not worth the white teeth. REMEMBER, there is nothing out there to soothe the ultra sharp pain while you are going through it. I wish I had read the reviews before buying. Waste of my $40 dollars. I do not recommend this project AT ALL!othing out there to soothe the ultra sharp pain while you are going through it. I wish I had read the reviews before buying. Everything was fine in my last checkup two months ago, so I figured these couldn't hurt. I guess that was my fault but I never imagined these strips would turn my teeth into Swiss cheese!<br />I would definitely do as the box recommends and consult a dentist prior to using these strips.

  2551. I've had problems finding a good whitening solution. The original Crest whitestrips are too gooey for me and would slide around... an uncomfortable treatment, but they did the job. I tried trays and whitening pastes, but they wind up treating the gums, cheeks, etc and for a few days I'd feel like I had been chewing on glass. When I read about the Luxe strips, I decided to give 'em a try. There is noticeably less gel on each strip... in fact, it's sometimes hard to get the strip off of the plastic backer. It really sticks to my teeth and I almost forget about 'em for the 30 minute treatment. Well... you don't forget about 'em, but you can go about your normal day and do things around the house or talk on the phone during the treatment. When you peel 'em off, they are still stuck on well to the teeth.<br /><br />I brush quickly before (to knock away anything that might prevent good contact of the gel to the tooth) and then follow my normal brushing routine when I'm done. I've used it every day for the past 6-7 days and I'm not experiencing any of the sensitivity issues or problems with my cheeks / gums that I've had before. I get a bit of dry-mouth for 30 min or so after the treatment, but nothing uncomfortable or that a sip or two of water won't solve.<br /><br />My teeth are noticeably whiter and the coffee stains are starting to disappear (my real reason for needing the product). Just what I needed!

  2572. They are correct that you can easily talk, drink, etc. with them in. I personally don't drink with them in since it's only a half an hour but certainly it won't bother the strips.<br /><br />I took a before photo and I'll try and post the 'after' once I am done with all 20 but even four strips in and I'm already sold on the product.<br /><br />Here are some quick items to be aware of:<br />1 - There is a minor taste that will hit the tip of your tongue as it contacts the back seam of the strips. Nothing major, but be aware it's not tasteless.<br />2 - I have not had any irritation at all. However, I did 2 days in a row, then started spacing to every other day so that may have helped.<br />3 - Removal - that's actually a bit of effort since the strips become very gummy and they have a very solid grip onto your teeth. That said, I'd far prefer that than if they were slipping around and sliding off since that would defeat the point.<br /><br />I previously did a dental whitening where they used a laser/light and ran you through multiple trays of stuff over a two+ hour period. My teeth were very,very sensitive for well over a week from it and the whitening effect both wasn't that much, and promptly disappeared in only a few months. Not at all worth the time, discomfort or money (I think it was $350 -$400 or so?).<br /><br />By contrast, these strips have already provided noticeable whitening 4 strips in, no discomfort at all, and a fraction of the cost.<br /><br />Highly recommend.

I do not mean necessarily just to cold air or cold drinks/ice. It's almost a short throbbing pain in some areas. It didn't persist for me, just happened for a few minutes after. Also...do NOT, I repeat, DO NOOOOT wear these longer than the recommended time on the instructions (30 minutes) if you want to avoid sensitivity. I went an hour (just to experiment) on two treatments and noticed a HUGE difference with pain and sensitivity. If this is a big concern for you, I did notice the mouth wash and toothpaste they offer under the same like do help with this issue. You could also consider trying a toothpaste FOR sensitive teeth to help.

  2672. I have had teeth whitening done by dentists twice before in my life. Both times were with custom made trays and 15% gels. I have used other over the counter Rembrant whiteners a few times since then with average results. This whitening product is the BEST over the counter that I have tried! It works almost as good as the professional dentist whitening and at a fraction of the cost. Do not brush your teeth immediately before using this product as it will make your gums burn. I ball up two paper towels and put them between the back of my teeth and my tongue. The paper towel will absorb the spit so it won't get under the strips and dilute the whitener. Set a cooking timer. Keep the strips in the full time, 30 minutes for this kit. The maximum shade of whitening depends largely on keeping it in those last few minutes. Use each day until the strips run out. The hard part is avoiding tea and coffee. In my opinion this kit works good. I hope this information helps.

  2738. This is my third box of Crest Whitestrips in a span of about six years. I did my first box according to the instructions and was really pleased with the results - since then, I keep a box handy for touch-ups every now and then. I'm a heavy herbal and green tea drinker, which is great for everything but trying to keep my whites pearly. These are perfect for brightening me up every few months or so. (And better than they were when I first started! These stay put on your teeth!)<br /><br />Each individual use packet has two strips - one for top teeth, one for bottom. I always dry my teeth with a towel, slap these babies on, and catch up on some reading or watch a show on Hulu. I keep a cup handy if I need to spit (it makes me salivate for some reason...and I don't like to swallow it)...overall, it's not a glamorous affair, so I definitely wait until I have some me time. :)<br /><br />The good:<br />This is a convenient, affordable option for teeth whitening that WORKS. People compliment my teeth on a regular basis and usually end up asking me how I did it...I credit this product & good oral hygiene habits. :) And of course, Amazon (and their awesome coupon you should be sure to clip!) has pretty much the best deal I've found. This can run you around $40 at your regular grocery stores, pharmacies, etc.<br /><br />The bad:<br />Sensitivity can definitely be an issue and is the reason I took off a star. If I lose track of time and leave them on longer, I pay for it later with sensitive teeth. Also, I pay attention to my teeth - if it starts to hurt, take them off! If I experience tooth sensitivity, I'll wait a week or two until I try again. An enamel-strengthening toothpaste and mouthwash is important when whitening your teeth and helps a lot. As far as taste - I don't think it's bad. I don't expect it to taste good and I don't swallow it - I mean, hello, I'm chemically whitening my teeth. However, I will say I remember the taste/smell took some getting used to when I first started...but nothing major. (Also, white marks in the beginning is normal - don't freak out, they go away. :) )<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />In terms of affordable and effective, this is your match. Whether it's your first time or just a maintenance product, I definitely recommend.st started...but nothing major. (Also, white marks in the beginning is normal - don't freak out, they go away. :) )<br /><br />Conclusion:<br />In terms of affordable and effective, this is your match. Whether it's your first time or just a maintenance product, I definitely recommend.

  2825. I have tried 3 types of Crest strips (7-day, 3-day, etc.) and in my opinion, these are definitely the best balance of results and (dis)comfort. In my experience, all 3 strips gave very similar (if not the same) whitening results. The determining factors of which strips to purchase depends on the amount of patience you may have and how sensitive your teeth/gums may be. With this version, you apply a top and bottom strip once a day for 30 minutes (20 days duration). The final results do take longer to obtain but i experienced very minimal teeth sensitivity. However, I will add that I use Sensodyne toothpaste which helps quite a bit with minimizing sensitivity issues.<br /><br />The strips themselves were very easy to apply and did a great job at adhering to my teeth. They do not have an excessive amount of whitening gel (compared to the 7-day strips) so application was very clean. The &#34;AdvanceSeal&#34; technology worked very well as the strip was still holding strong to my teeth after the required 30 minutes. Overall, usage was uneventful (which is a great thing).<br /><br />I have been using some form of whitening strips every 10-12 months for the past 5 years and these are my favorite version. I highly recommend this product if you do not mind the extended duration and/or if you suffer from teeth sensitivity.

  2847. OK, first lets talk about cost effectiveness. For the price of this product ($35), the strips do a good job of removing yellow and stains from teeth. No, it won't give you those &#34;bleached&#34; white looking teeth, but it will remove layers of yellow on both the inside and outside of your enamel. Does it look the same as a $200 whitening treatment? Probably not, but for those that need some years of yellowing removed, or perhaps as a maintenance treatment, this is the product - at the right price - for you.<br /><br />As for my own personal success with these strips? Before, I had teeth that were slightly yellowed - most likely from my love of drinking tea. I used the strips as directed, 1/2 hour every day. I put them on at night and just went about my business. No, they don't have a pleasant taste and they aren't the most comfortable things to have in your mouth, but should you really expect a yummy flavor from strips with peroxide in them, striping off layers of yellow? Nope. I noticed results after four days, and after 15 days my teeth were exactly what I wanted - a nice natural white color (not &#34;bleached&#34; white, as I think that looks silly and wouldn't want that). I didn't need the full 20 days of treatment, so I still have 5 strips I can use as maintenance in a few months.<br /><br />I gave the product 4 stars instead of 5 because I did have some sensitivity issues after about a week of using them. Nothing too serious - my teeth just felt tingly and cold air/food bothered me a little. The package does say that there may be some teeth sensitivity while using the strips, so it's not like consumers aren't warned beforehand. Also, you have to be careful how you place the strips on your teeth. If you put part of the strip on your gum, it's going to hurt after a few days.<br /><br />Overall, a good whitening treatment for the price. I would recommend this to anyone in need of an affordable whitening that wants a natural looking smile. If you're looking for bleached white teeth, however, this is not the product for you.r bleached white teeth, however, this is not the product for you.
  2848. these are great. my teeth are sensitive and i fear bleaching to the degree that i don't do it and never have with any regularity. these are wonderful. the taste is ok. there is no sensitivity and the white pops after a few uses. i will use them as long they are around

Wrongggg..<br />I told the lady from Crest everything I have just said, she said I was unable to receive a refund because I had already sent in for that 10.00 rebate. And she said , you can only get one . Needless to say I was very mad and upset that I was unable to get my refund. I told the lady that I would expect that they would deduct the 10.00 that I had sent for, but she said there was no way.. I even spoke to her supervisor. So, what I am telling anyone who reads my review, if you try their product, don't send in for the 10.00 rebate. Wait till you have used all the product, then if it doesn't help you, you should be able to get your refund. Atleast that is what they led me to believe. But as for myself, I was very disappointed in the product. It did not whiten my teeth at all as far as I could tell. Barb
  2868. They work, but not as well as I hoped.
  2869. I grew up in a family that never talked about dental hygiene. My teeth were not a pretty sight. I have used this for 3 days (have the fourth in now) and the difference is already remarkable. No more hiding my teeth when I talk! I can't even imagine what they'll look like after I finish the pack... I'm a little afraid I won't recognize myself!<br /><br />I thought I would have difficulty putting/keeping them on, but it's actually pretty easy. My teeth are not perfectly straight, but I still manage to get these to cover all of the area needed.<br /><br />A lot of people mentioned sensitivity. I have always had sensitive teeth, but I have had no problem with these so far. They even go over my gums at some points (as I said, my teeth are not straight), but it hasn't bothered me a bit. I will update if this changes throughout the course of the treatments, but I was so excited that I had to review this now!

I actually have to use a toothpaste against sensitivity in the days before and after I plan to whiten. I'm going to use this box up and then probably get a different formula. I'm torn though, because I want something more effective than this since I'm not getting the results I want, but the sensitivity is really painful. Oh well.

I am on day 11 and am not seeing noticeable results. For me, the strips do not adhere to my teeth as tightly as I had expected based on the product description, therefore they are not at all difficult to remove. I have not experienced any pain or sensitivity but on the other hand, I have also not seen a lot of whitening. It has been 2 years since I last whitened my teeth and I do drink coffee everyday but the box says that it removes 14 years, or something similar, of stains. I agree with another reviewer on here that the old crest strips that were cheaper and used twice a day were much more effective at whitening teeth. One more thing, with the older brand of crest strips, I used to have a lot of gel remaining on my teeth that would need brushed off after but none at all with these new strips which makes me wonder... I have 9 more days of strips so maybe there will be a miraculous whitening at like day 19 or something, if that happens, i will definitely let you know.

  3003. I've tried both and have been much happier with these. They adhere and stay on much better than the Pro Effects (the previous version of these, not the Intensive one) and the results are faster.<br /><br />I grind my teeth so I've caused some wear to the back of my teeth which makes them extremely sensitive. Because of this, I can't wrap the strips all the way to the back of my teeth or I'll be miserable for days. What I do is cut them in half so they only go in the front of my teeth, only my dentists sees the back of my teeth anyway so who cares what that looks like. I have a small mouth so either the short or long ones cover well but you can just cut them up and use half of a short and half of a long one day, and the other halves the next. I would do this with the pro effects but I had a big problem with them staying on. They were always sliding around while these, because they adhere so well, stay in place just fine. They work just as well as wrapping them and I get double the use making them very cost effective

  3026. I decided to try a scientific experiment. I applied the strips to my upper teeth only, leaving the lowers untouched as a control. After applying all 40 strips, one per day in the prescribed manner, to just my upper teeth, I compared uppers to lowers. I could see no whitening effect whatever. My teeth are old but sound. No pain but also no gain.<br /><br /> I wonder if much of the improvement people report is imaginary. It would be easy to see what one hopes to see, unless photographic records are kept or a controlled experiment such as mine is carried out.

It strengthens my teeth and when I am using the White Stripes, I hardly feel the annoying sensitivity. Depending on how sensitive your teeth are may require you using the Sensodyne a little longer before and after using this product!.
